The purpose of the Customer Support Engineer is to manage out-of-manual conditions (OMC's) findings on turbine engine components with the goal of finding permanent solutions to repetitive issues.
The Customer Support Engineer investigates complex issues and uses technical data to disposition and communicate the repair path for engine components.
The Customer Support Engineer has opportunities to use creative thinking to find innovative solutions to common issues, working with OEM engineers and other engineers at CRT to meet customer needs.
The Customer Support Engineer will gain diverse knowledge and experience within the aviation industry and many manufacturing processes.
The Customer Support Center Engineer is responsible to: - Provide customer support by investigation, evaluation, and reporting Out of Manual Conditions (OMC) on various engine model components.
Technical report writing will be required.
- Manage OMC's for assigned components by tracking, reviewing, and communicating issues to meet the customer need.
- Identify, communicate, and assist in solving OMC trends and repetitive processing issues that cause delays of customer components using forward planning and continuous improvement.
- At least a 2-year engineering degree or a 4-year STEM degree.
- Prior experience using or interpreting technical requirements.
- Interest in engineering problem solving.
- Demonstrates high ownership and accountability.
- Ability to understand and work through complex scenarios.
Component Repair Technologies, Inc. (CRT) is an FAA-certified repair station specializing in gas turbine engine component repairs for air, land, and sea.

Our success and world-class reputation in the aviation repair industry can be attributed to our long-standing commitment to quality products and quality service, ensuring we exceed FAA standards and customer expectations.
Something founder Tom Wheeler realized early on is that we work best as a team and the RAOWIT concept: employees performing Random Acts of Whatever it Takes.
There is important work to do that requires many skills and specializations and ROWIT reminds us that we are all important parts of the process.
We all matter at CRT.

This position offers you the opportunity to work in a project team environment with other engineers and designers involved in the detailed electrical design and project management of utility-scale renewable energy projects.
As a Lead Renewable Energy Engineer in our Electric Grid Infrastructure Services business unit you will:
Interact with renewable energy developers during the development or project conception phase and support the execution of engineering and design project work.
As a Lead Renewable Energy Engineer, you will take an active role in all aspects of the project, from project conceptualization, work planning, project design and project execution.

You will work on challenging assignments that include investigating, trouble-shooting, and problem solving a wide variety of challenges related to renewable energy facility designs and integration of new assets with existing infrastructure.

You will be responsible for client relationships, mentoring team members, overseeing projects, prepare reports that present technical and project information in a clear and concise manner and meet client requirements and S&L formats, support interconnection applications and actively support the growth of our renewable energy group.
Develop your career via peer-learning through sharing of knowledge with other experienced engineers by way of S&L's systems of process and associated Communities of Practice.
In addition, you may have the opportunity to travel to client sites as needed.
Dependent upon your location, this opportunity offers a generous relocation package.
S&L is actively expanding our renewable energy teams to our Glendale, AZ and Denver, CO offices.
We do not sponsor employees for work authorization in the U.S. for this position.
This position requires a BSEE degree from an ABET-accredited engineering program.
A Master's degree in a business (e.g., MBA) or engineering discipline is a plus.
10 or more years of experience in the renewable energy industry.
Experience with electrical collection system designs.
Experience with renewable energy technologies (i.e., wind, solar, battery energy storage, etc.).
Experience in electrical grid interconnections (i.e. single line design, permit application, compliance with electrical codes and utility standards, etc.).
Experience with detailed design activities associated with renewable energy projects.
Experience with owner's engineering activities during renewable energy project execution is a plus.
Experience with battery energy storage system designs and/or energy management system designs is a plus.
Excellent verbal/written communication skills.
Experience writing technical reports and proposals.
Solid interpersonal skills and ability to work with and guide others.
Project planning and leadership skills.

SUMMARY: This is the first level of the Engineering classification with the Pike Engineering's Professional Services team that serves in the electric utility industry.

This position provides engineering and technical expertise to solve problems for electrical distribution systems operation and maintenance functions, under close supervision of engineers and project managers.
The Professional Services team helps clients with electric system planning, grid analytics, renewable energy and battery storage integration, and grid modernization efforts, among other things.

Incumbents are expected to know or develop skills in electrical distribution system planning, battery energy storage, renewable generation systems and software packages including CYME, Synergi, Milsoft PSCAD and ETAP.

Incumbents should have an ability to quickly master technical engineering concepts, learn complex modeling software, and help develop solutions and customer deliverables in the form of technical reports and circuit models to help clients in the reliable and economic operation of, and modernization of, their electric distribution systems.
Incumbents should be familiar with industry trends including Distributed Energy Resources (DER) like solar power and Battery Energy Storage Systems (BESS) as well as Smart Grid technologies.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Under supervision in the area of power delivery and grid analysis, the incumbent will provide: Engineering/technical expertise and guidance in the identification, analysis, and resolution of problems.
Effective planning, organizing, estimating, scheduling, and monitoring of work activities.
Thorough, timely, and accurate technical reports, correspondence, documentation, calculations, and sketches.
Continuous improvement of job-related engineering, technical and professional knowledge, skills, and performance.
Effective oral and written communication skills.
Should be able to maintain electrical circuit models and data files.
Support the company's goals and represent the company positively and professionally.
Interact with customer's internal engineers and technical personnel on a day-to-day basis.
Develop and maintain professional relationships with customers.
Perform other duties as assigned by management.

RELATIONSHIP OUTSIDE WORK GROUP: Exchange of information, which occasionally requires tact and/or diplomacy.
SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES: None

We are seeking a skilled Network Design Engineer with expertise in DWDM and Ethernet networks, coupled with a fundamental understanding of outside plant fiber infrastructure and power and space requirements within the telecommunications industry.
In this role, you will be responsible for reviewing network designs, developing optimization or migration plans, and ensuring the efficient implementation of services within the network.
You will also play a key role in developing comprehensive budgets to support these plans and tracking cost savings post-migration.
Excellent communication, time management, and project management skills are essential to succeed in this position.
Skills: Network optimization, Design, OSP, Fiber, ethernet, DWDM, Optical, Power, Space Requirements, Migration Projects, budgeting, project management, Fujitsu 9500 and 1Finity.
Network Design Review: - Evaluate existing network designs and identify opportunities for optimization or migration to enhance network performance and reliability.
- Conduct thorough assessments of DWDM and Ethernet networks, considering outside plant fiber infrastructure and connectivity requirements.
- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather network design requirements and ensure alignment with business objectives.
- Assess optical challenges and design requirements in order to develop network optimization designs.
Plan Development: - Develop detailed plans and strategies for network optimization or migration projects, ensuring scalability, efficiency, and cost-effectiveness.
- Identify potential risks and challenges associated with network changes and develop mitigation strategies.
- Work closely with stakeholders to understand their needs and incorporate them into the design plans.
Budgeting: - Create comprehensive budgets for network optimization or migration projects, considering equipment, resources, and other associated costs.
- Collaborate with finance teams to ensure accurate cost estimation and allocation of funds.
- Continuously monitor project expenses and identify opportunities for cost savings.
Project Management: - Provide project management support, ensuring that plans are implemented effectively and within established timelines.
- Coordinate with internal and external teams to ensure smooth project execution, adherence to design specifications, and resolution of any issues that may arise.
- Regularly communicate project status, milestones, and risks to stakeholders.
Post-Migration Validation: - Validate and track cost savings achieved through network optimization or migration.
- Conduct post-migration audits to ensure the successful implementation of design changes.
- Identify and address any issues or gaps in the network design, proposing corrective actions as necessary.
Experience Level: Expert Level.

The Staff Building Automation Engineer will participate on both multi-disciplinary and controls-specific engineering teams to develop and review Building Automation Engineering design packages, perform calculations and develop engineering solutions in support of capital and retrofit projects in a variety of locations.

+ Evaluate technical bids and managing vendor and subconsultant contracts
+ Review and approving of vendor and subconsultant drawings, including Sequences of Operation, Points Lists, Engineering Drawings, Bill of Materials, Graphics, and Test Scripts

+ Facilitate multi-consultant and Owner meetings for design changes and implementation
+ Lead production of engineering drawings using Autodesk Revit, AutoCAD Electrical, or ePlan

+ Ensures adherence to client and industry standards and applies client or industry standards, guidelines, specifications, practices and procedures in preparing designs.
+ All other duties as assigned.
Qualifications
+ Bachelor's in Engineering from an ABET accredited program
+ Master of Science degree in above Engineering programs or related may be substituted for 1 year experience.
+ PE license preferred in Mechanical or Instrumentation & Controls
+ Minimum 2 years of either Building Automation System (BAS) or mechanical HVAC engineering experience
+ Ability to interface, mentor and collaborate effectively with your team members
+ Demonstrated ability to work in a team
+ Strong organization, delegation, presentation and communication (both written and verbal) skills
+ Proficient with business and engineering applications.
+ Proficent in Microsoft Office
+ Working knowledge of Autodesk Revit and drawing production from Revit is preferred

Technology Protection Engineer Location: Huntsville, AL, US Job ID: 15897

ATR and Celestar Corporation have an IMMEDIATE NEED and are actively seeking multiple Technology Protection Engineers - Level II who will perform duties in support of the U.S. Army Intelligence and Security Command (INSCOM) Army Security Office (ASO) Army Research and Technology Protection Center (ARTPC) and will be seated in Huntsville, AL.
If interested and qualified, we welcome you to apply for this challenging opportunity.
CLEARANCE REQUIREMENT: Active Top-Secret Level Clearance with SCI Access.
Clearance, Access and Investigation must appear in DISS and be within scope (5 Years).
ANTICIPATED AWARD DATE: This Contract Has Been Awarded!
ANTICIPATED START DATE: May 2023
PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE: 1 Base Year + 4 Option Years
LOCATION: Huntsville, AL
About Us: Celestar, a Veteran Owned Company is Very Competitive with Salaries and Benefits.
As an example, we offer Company Paid Benefits that include Employee and Family Dental Insurance, Employ Health Insurance, Life Insurance and Disability Insurance as well.
We also offer a 401K retirement company match, paid Holidays and Personal Time off.

BACKGROUND: The U.S. Army Intelligence and Security Command (INSCOM) Army Security Office (ASO) Army Research and Technology Protection Center (ARTPC) Support Services has initiated this effort to provide support in the development of security related documentation to include Science & Technology Protection Plans (S&T PP) and Program Protection Plans (PPPs), critical technology reviews, and threat/mitigation plans that utilize a systematic approach to technology protection, intelligence analysis, and multi-discipline security specialist support to provide risk mitigation across the Army to protect Army personnel, facilities, infrastructure, networks and national security information.
The United States research laboratories, engineering centers, and defense industrial base are developing the advanced technology that will form the heart of the Armys future fighting force.
Foreign Governments and companies that both use and sell military systems will go to great lengths to acquire the advanced technologies that dominate future warfare.
Identification and protection of those technologies is essential to the Armys mission and ability to fight and win when those systems are fielded.
When foreign Governments and companies illegally acquire knowledge of the U.S. advanced technologies it is also essential that the Army understand the effect of that compromise.

The Army must have an integrated Research and Technology Program (RTP), Security, Cyber Incident Damage Assessment (CIDA) program, and Modernization Security Protection (MSP) with the ability to perform these critical missions with a high degree of confidence of success.

RESPONSIBILITIES -Provide RTP engineering analysis, including Controlled Technical Information (CTI) identification, Critical Program Information (CPI) assessments and Critical Function (CF) analysis, supply chain analysis, vulnerability analysis, and risk evaluation.
-Provide inputs to threat identification, security-related protection measure development, and countermeasures development recommendations based on engineering analysis results.

-Document results of the support and related meetings (other than re-occurring) will be documented in an ARTPC assessment/survey memorandum, AAR/Executive Summary (EXSUM), in the customer tracking database, and as part of the monthly status report (MSR).

-Work with government and contractor security specialists to develop an effective Interim/S&T Protection Plan and/or Program Protection Plan and ensure the plan is satisfactorily implemented at Government as well as contractor facilities where CTI and/or CPI resides.
-Conduct CPI Surveys, CPI Assessments, and CTI identification methodology reviews, on behalf of Army customers.
REQUIREMENTS -Bachelor's Degree in Engineering (e.g. mechanical, electrical, civil, chemical, aerospace, materials etc.).
-Four (4) years of engineering experience.
-Experience briefing and interacting with SES/General Officer levels preferred.
-Exceptional oral and written communication skills to effectively interface with senior military officials, managers, and subordinates.
-Valid US Passport.
IMPORTANT NOTE: This is a Best Athlete Selection Process! Please ensure that the required and/or desired experience is reflected on your resume to receive fair and competitive consideration.

We are looking for a hardworking and hard-working RF Integrity Engineer for Apple's IC Packaging team.
RFI (RF Integrity) team develops novel methodologies to solve coupling, spur, and coexistence issues in highly integrated RF systems through simulation and lab debug.
The engineering regime covers Si, package, module, PCB, and form-factor device.
The working methods are constantly evolving and blurring boundaries of existing domains.
As an RF Integrity Engineer, you will explore multiple aspects of RF technology and expand the boundary of innovation.
The team is small and the coverage is huge due to its multidiscipline nature.
Key Qualifications + BS and 3+ years of relevant industry experience.
+ Excellent problem solving skills in a dynamic and complex environment when boundary is not clearly defined.
+ Strong fundamentals in microwave engineering and 2D/3D EM simulation tools.
+ Deep knowledge on interaction between EM model and other circuit structures.
+ Familiar with RF impairment at block and transceiver levels, including amplifier, filter, PLL, etc.
+ Experience with RF lab equipment, such as VNA, signal generator, spectrum analyzer, real-time scope, probe station, etc.
+ Enthusiasm in learning new technology and willingness to take risks to solve problems.
+ Strong academic training and knowledge on fundamentals of SI and PI issues is a plus.
+ Familiar with RFIC design and simulation flow is preferred.
+ Experience in advanced transceiver design and integration is a plus.
+ RF system modeling and link budgeting for transceiver chains.
+ Preferred experience on RF module/board development.
Description - Conduct 2D/3D EM simulations on design optimization and coupling mitigation for IC, packages and boards.
- Enhance EM modeling and analysis methodology to achieve accurate correlation between simulation and measurement at various levels.
- Design high performance RF components, such as transmission line, filter, matching network, in various technologies.
- Collaborate with IC, package, and product teams to address spur/desense issues in simulation and lab environment.
Education & Experience - BS and 3+ years of relevant industry experience.

Seeking an experienced Analog/Mixed-signal IC Design Engineer for developing complex mixed-signal ICs for Timing and Infrastructure applications.
The position requires a strong analog mixed-signal design background including a strong history of innovative product and IP definition and design.
Depending on experience level, the individual will participate in product roadmaps, definition, technology selection, design, and verification.

The individual will have a role in defining and implementing the overall system architecture, designing transistor-level analog circuit blocks, simulating sub-system performance, creating and using behavioral models of blocks and the entire IC, doing and/or supervising physical layout, verifying circuit and chip-level operation and performance, and assisting with tape-out related activities.

Responsibilities will also include detailed documentation, silicon evaluation and debugging, production test development support, customer support, and other activities as required for the achievement of high-volume production.
Architects, designs and verifies circuits, logic, systems, algorithms, etc. to meet product requirements.
Determine design approaches and parameters.
Develops innovative new designs for patenting or protecting as trade secret.
Demonstrates good judgment in solving a broad range of issues, based on an advanced understanding of industry practices and company policies and procedures.
Responsible for custom layout, including overseeing the work of layout designers.
Reports on design results through design reviews, in accordance with company quality requirements and resolves action items generated as a result of these reviews.
Attends design reviews to provide input and learn from other designers' experiences.
Research design techniques through technical publications and seminars.
Supports marketing in product definition.
Having a wide-ranging experience uses professional concepts and company objectives to resolve complex issues in creative and effective way.
Determines methods and procedures on new assignments and may coordinate the activities of other personnel.
A technology-related master's degree or equivalent training and 8 or more years of analog/mixed-signal design experience developing mixed-signal ICs.
An advanced degree may reduce the minimum experience required.
Strong knowledge of engineering fundamentals.
Advanced knowledge of CMOS fabrication processes.
Advanced knowledge of MOS transistors and analog/digital circuit design.
Knowledge of complex AD/DC analysis (poles, zeros, compensation).
Advanced signal analysis knowledge.
Basic understanding of CMOS and BCD parasitic junctions and the risks associated with them.
Strong parasitic analysis knowledge (capacitance, resistance, power grid).
Advanced knowledge of circuit building blocks (e.g., OPAMP, gm-C filters, switch capacitors, ADC, DAC, state-machines, and bus interfaces).
Advanced understanding of layout tradeoffs for performance and size.
Advanced design skills in system modeling.
Strong knowledge of UNIX, Matlab, and circuit simulation tools.
Proficiency in layout verification, DRC, LVS.
Additional skills (one or more of these are highly desirable).
Working knowledge of device physics.
Working knowledge of digital design and design flows.
System knowledge (e.g., High Performance PLLs).
Knowledge of scripting language (python, shell, skill).
Advanced laboratory measurement skills (analog, digital).
Knowledge of MS Office documentation, spreadsheet, presentation tools or equivalent tools.
Familiarity with quality systems documentation and procedures.
Competency with design tools.
Excellent written and verbal presentation skills.

You will be part of Cisco's Security Business Group (SBG), with a focus on next generation network security.

Specifically, you will drive innovative solutions leveraging the full strength of the Cisco Security portfolio working across product engineering leads, key support functions, product partners and other cross-functional stakeholders within & outside of Cisco Security.
Reporting to the VP and CTO of the Office of the CTO, you'll work in partnership with Engineering, Product Management, and our diverse senior technical talent community.
You will join a team of seasoned leaders of people and technology building creative best in class security solutions.
You are recognized as an inspiring technical leader, mentor, and architect.
You have a proven track record to influence others, build consensus, engage engineers, and drive towards success technical decisions that support business objectives.
You partner well with other teams and enjoy driving the technical direction to achieve successful customer outcomes.
You will be working with both technical and business leaders across SBG and the wider Cisco.
You will also be establishing relationships with partners and external standards bodies that our customers consider to be essential to measurement and understanding.
Focus on the evolution and efficacy of our detection sciences and security analytics.
Set, measure, and achieve efficacy goals across the SBG portfolio.
Build relationships and partnerships with external standards of metrics organizations like MITRE.
Participate in constructive technical reviews of our drivers and help us develop new detection features.
Collaborate on a product roadmap and help define the team's overall efficacy strategy.
Keep driving the advancement of testing and methodologies that improve our detection sciences.
Work closely with a globally distributed team of versatile peers.
20+ Years of experience working in cyber security.
Demonstrated experience building security research teams, from the ground up.
10+ Years' experience with threat detection tools and technologies, including building product roadmaps, creation of detection models, and monitoring.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Operational knowledge with standard debugging and analysis tools.
Dedicated individual, with passion to learn and understand across diverse technologies.
Understanding of existing threat intelligence and security analytics, endpoint & network security, & cloud native architecture.
Familiarity with Agile development concepts, OKR's, and version control systems.
We're global, we're adaptable, we're diverse, and our security portfolio is as extensive as it is groundbreaking.
Have you heard of Threat, Detection & Response, Zero Trust by Duo, Common Services Engineering, or Cloud & Network Security?
The only thing we're missing is YOU.
Join an enterprise security leader with a start-up culture, committed to driving innovation and giving you the opportunity to make an impact.
We #InnovateToWin and we know we're better together, that's why we're dedicated to inclusivity, collaboration, and diversity in everything we do.
We're proud to be the Best Small and Mid-Size Enterprises Security Solution.

Cisco Secure continues to grow and evolve year after year with 100% of Fortune 100 Companies using our products, and we're excited to see the new heights we'll reach with your passion for security, your customer focus, and your desire to change things up!
There are so many amazing reasons to join Cisco.

About Technica: At Technica Corporation, our goal is to provide exceptional professional services and innovative technology solutions that meet or exceed our customer's expectations.
We specialize in a wide range of advanced information technology solutions from Systems Engineering to Information Assurance, and from Software Development to Product Solutions.

From our locations across the DC Metro area, San Antonio, Texas and Huntsville, Alabama, we provide technological subject matter expertise, program management and business process knowledge as a trusted advisor in support of our Department of Defense and other Federal Agency customers.

Technica is a technology solutions company providing technology integration, professional services, products, and innovative technology solutions to Defense, Intelligence, Law Enforcement, and Federal Civilian Agencies.

We are recognized as an experienced and trusted advisor to our customers with specializations in network operations, transport and infrastructure, cyber defense and security, application integration, software development and support, systems engineering and training, and product deployment planning and support.
Technica is looking for a highly qualified Chief Engineer/Architect.

The selected candidate must work closely with the Program Manager and be able to design and implement new systems using Model Based Systems Engineering (MBSE) analysis to provide solutions of hardware and software for use in naval environments and conditions.

This is a new program which will require the creation and implementation from the ground up including the creation of a System Engineering Management Plan and implement extensive use of Agile programming techniques.
The systems will be deployed worldwide in various naval environments with high quality reliability standards for use in these environments.
They will need to be highly flexible and modular to adapt to the multitude of deployment scenarios and uses.
All products and supporting artifacts must pass muster for formal technical reviews and audits as defined in IEEE 15288.2 including entry and exit criteria for every audit.
Manufacturing and development plans must include supply chain risk analysis and mitigation strategies inclusive of all critical components.
Creation of these systems must have security and quality baked in to the process to ensure minimal exposure to vulnerabilities including cyber vulnerabilities.
The individual selected will lead a matrixed-functional team of hardware and software engineers, operations, and logistics teams aligned to common program performance goals.
An ability to break down complex systems into logical and physical components and derive the proper prioritization for mission success is a must.
+ Technical Bachelor's degree in STEM
+ 12+ years of directly related experience.
+ IAT level 2 security certification
+ Active Secret Clearance - ability/willingness to upgrade.
+ Model Based Systems Engineering experience.
+ Experience creating and implementing a System Engineering Management Plan for Hardware and Software integration using Agile Development Techniques
+ Agile Programming experience
+ Experience with in IEEE 15288.2 use for DoD systems
+ Experience leading a team of hardware integrators and Agile developers
+ Occasional domestic business travel required
+ IAT level 3 security certification
+ Active TS/SCI
+ Navy operations and cyber operations experience
+ Experience with shake and bake testing and quality
+ Delivery of manufacturing and software products to the Navy
+ Safe familiarization
+ Knowledge of DEVSECOPS processes and implementations
+ Model based system engineering Certification
+ PMP Agile
+ IAT level 2 or 3
+ Model Based System Engineering Certification
+ PMP Agile

At Air Products, we've been helping our customers to become more productive, energy efficient and sustainable for more than 75 years.
With approximately 16,000 employees and operations in 50 countries, we serve customers across a wide range of industries from food and beverage to medical, energy and transportation.
We supply a unique portfolio of atmospheric and process gases, equipment, and services.
We are looking for a Principal Rotating Machinery Engineer with significant industry experience to join the engineering team based in our Hersham UK office.
As a Principal Rotating Machinery Engineer you will work as part of the Process Technology team responsible for all aspects of the product development of mid-sized Air Separation plants.
The plants developed by this team are sold into the on-site, third party and intercompany markets worldwide.

Your main responsibilities will be focussing on the following areas: Bid Support Evaluation of different machine options (capital, power, schedule and technical risk) to allow the final machine to be selected for a given opportunity.
This involves a close working relationship with Process Engineering to optimize the process cycle and machine selection.
Communication with vendors to ensure that offerings are received in time, that offers are fully understood, and that the vendor has supplied their best offer.
Preparation of final numbers for the power guarantee, so that the best overall offer is put forward to the business area.

Liaison with the Technology Manager to identify step outs or new technology and completion of technical risk statements and mitigation plans so that all costs are identified, and risk areas understood.
Work with the regional project execution teams to provide information so that they can purchase the correct machine based upon the evaluations done at the bid stage.
Support the regional Rotating Equipment Engineer during machine performance testing at the vendor works and, in the field, to ensure that the machine meets its performance commitments.
Capture feedback related to the machine selection at all stages of the project so that the product, future bids and projects can get the benefit of this experience.
Perform tasks as requested by the Lead Rotating Equipment Engineer so that competitive product offerings can be developed.
Update product documentation so that the bids and/or projects use the latest and best information thereby avoiding mistakes and reducing costs.
+ Degree level qualification in Mechanical Engineering (or related).
+ Chartered Engineer (CEng), European Engineer (EUR ING) or equivalent affiliation with a professional body.
+ Demonstrable experience in the specification, evaluation and engineering of a range of rotating machinery types in an EPC or Industrial Gases project environment.

+ Detailed knowledge of rotating equipment including integrally geared centrifugal compressors, reciprocating compressors, turbo expander units, centrifugal pumps, cooling water towers and cooling water systems.
+ Strong working knowledge of International Codes, API standards, compressor test codes, and EIGA/IGC standards for compressors and pumps, and experience with CE/UKCA marking.
+ Experience with equipment in cryogenic service is desirable.
+ Highly competent written and spoken communication and able to use a range of standard software such as MS Word and MS Excel to prepare technical documents and to write technical reports.
+ The Process Technology team is very dynamic, and this influential role involves a high workload with associated tight deadlines.
+ This combination of factors presents more opportunities to develop as an individual.
+ The job holder should therefore have the ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment and be comfortable with priorities that can change rapidly.

CACI's SAFFIRE team is at the forefront of developing and operating state-of-the-art of Geospatial Intelligence analysis software.
The SAFFIRE team builds and maintains an exceptionally powerful platform enabling our users to address challenging real-world problems by converting disparate data into actionable information.
The team is deeply passionate about its mission and takes tremendous pride in our work.

We work directly with operational users to design, develop, and maintain capabilities that empower analysts to create actionable intelligence from the massive volumes of Geospatial Intelligence data to give our intel and combat organizations the decision advantage over our near-peer adversaries.

What You'll Get to Do: As a Data Integration Engineer supporting the SAFFIRE program, you will be working closely with software developers and teams to establish a consolidated data analytics environment utilizing COTS and FOSS software.
You will collaborate on designing, developing, and implementing custom data analytic solutions to ingest and exploit new and existing data sources to enable big data analytics.
Your role will involve creating efficient ETL processes, troubleshooting integration issues, and ensuring data accuracy and quality.

You will be a key member of the team, where the rubber meets the road, doing work that matters for some of the U.S. Government's most critical missions, and utilizing the latest technologies in Cloud Computing, AI/ML, and DevSecOps.

The Computing and Information Technology directorate is embarking on a multi-year effort to replace our legacy ERP Human Capital Management and Finance systems.

+ Collaborate with ERP system integrators to oversee solution design and implementation processes
+ Oversee the technical delivery of custom development, integrations, data migration, testing, and documentation elements of implementations
+ Assess technology through the understanding of emerging trends, disruptions, and how it layers onto existing and evolving business practices

+ Provide counsel on a broad range of technologies, platforms, and vendor offerings to drive targeted business outcomes

+ In-depth knowledge of ERP technologies and trends
+ Proven successful project implementation experience, especially delivering ERP solutions

+ Knowledge and experience in applying layered architecture patterns
+ Expertise in data management and integration

At Apple, we work every day to create products that enrich people's lives.

Our Advertising Platforms team makes it possible for people around the world to easily access informative and imaginative content on their devices while helping publishers and developers promote and monetize their work.
Today, our technology and services power advertising in Search Ads in the App Store and Apple News.
The Ad Platforms engineering team takes a customer-centric approach to building advertising products, platforms and algorithms that are secure, innovative and preserve our customers' privacy.
Engineering, Operations and Product Excellence are the three key pillars for our team.
We are looking for a seasoned Senior Architect who can work with key stakeholders within the organization to drive the technology strategy for Demand platform capabilities!
The ideal candidate for Senior Ad Platform Architect will come from the ranks of the industry's most senior and experienced engineers.
They will possess extraordinary capabilities ranging from high-level vision to low-level implementation.

Eversource is looking for a Distribution Design Associate Engineer to be located in East Hampton or Danielson, CT.
An entry-level position within the Distribution Design Engineer (DDE) progression reporting to an Engineering Lead.
This position will provide the individual with experience and training necessary for advancement to the fully qualified level of Distribution Design Engineer.

Duties will include assisting in identifying improvements and major repair needs on the distribution system, providing engineering support to Field Engineering Design for certain customer additions and assisting with system improvements for assigned circuits.
Individual will review daily interruption reports and analyze projected circuit deficiencies (e.g. voltage, overloads, etc.) for assigned circuits.
Individual will also assist the DDE/Lead with developing recommendations on equipment replacement vs repair to maximize Return on Asset (ROA).
Individual will participate during major restoration efforts including Emergency Preparedness.
Essential Functions: - Assist with the planning function and performance for all assigned circuits.
- Assist in identifying benefits from individual projects and predicted desired outcomes.
- Provide engineering support for specific projects.
- Assist with engineering resolutions for multiple outages in the Distribution System.
- Create field work in current work management system.
- Assist DDE/Lead until proficient in support of the following: + EMF communications and/or measurements for customers.
+ Real Estate Department and Customer to negotiate easements as required.
+ Account Executives with customer quality of service issues.
+ Operations with distribution issues. This includes review switching, develop contingency plans, prioritizing work, monitoring yellow tags, etc.
+ Engineering support to Field Engineering Design.
+ P&CE on developing Recloser and Breaker settings.
- Considers safety in all circuit analysis.
- Makes direct contact with customer and develop corrective actions.
- Provide regulator and capacitor control settings for Electrical Maintenance.
- Assist in outage, voltage, and power quality investigations and will engineer corrective action to prevent reoccurrence.
Provide reports as required.
- Works with DDE/Lead in the development of distribution projects and will be required to present to the Connecticut Project Authorization Committee CTPAC for approval.
- Evaluate proposed DG interconnection applications.
- Review and implement annual procedures, (e.g. TD941).
- Utilize electronic software tools to model and analyze the distribution system (SynerGee, PTI, USAmp, PI, Visio, etc.).
- Other related duties as assigned, including support to SOC.
- Will have nonexclusive, non-supervisory, storm restoration and emergency assignments.
Education, Experience and Skills: - Education: A Bachelor's degree in Engineering is required, Electrical Engineering preferred.
- Experience: Zero (0) to Three (3) years of equivalent experience in Energy Delivery is preferred.
- Technical Skills: + Knowledge of distribution systems is desired.
+ Must be able to work in a team environment.
+ Knowledgeable of various computer applications including Microsoft Office.
Circuit analysis software skills preferred.
+ Strong written and verbal communication skills.
+ Must hold a valid motor vehicle operator's license.
Compensation and Benefits: + The annual salary range for this position is $78,000 -$82,000, plus incentive.

Gannett Fleming's Geotechnical, Dams & Hydraulics specialists have the in-depth knowledge to excel on the most challenging geotechnical assignments.
We provide innovative solutions for dams, foundations, underground construction, earth structures, levees, water resources projects, ports & harbors, and marginal building sites.

Our geotechnical engineers and geologists specialize in earthen dam stability and seepage, landslides, earth retention structures, geotechnical earthquake engineering, seismic hazards, earthquake ground motion development, and building and bridge structure foundations.

We have completed thousands of geotechnical and geophysical investigations across the U.S. - from small-scale projects to large, complex dams, highways, bridges, piers, wharves, and underground structures.
We are currently looking for Staff Geotechnical Engineers to support critical infrastructure design and construction throughout California.

Our projects include transportation facilities (structures, roadways, rail, airports, ports, and harbors), water conveyance structures (levees, canals, flumes, pipelines), dams, bridges, stream restoration, and many others to help solve California's critical geotechnical challenges.
This is an opportunity to work directly with civil and structural engineers and geologists to implement creative geotechnical solutions through all phases of a project's lifecycle.
This is a hybrid position and you must be able to commute to either our Irvine, CA or Oakland, CA office as needed.
Our Irvine office is adjacent to two major freeways (5 and 405) and is within walking distance to shopping centers, dining, and an Irvine iShuttle bus stop.
Office perks include a free parking garage with EV charging stations and detailing services and an on-site gym!
Our Oakland office is conveniently located a short 5-minute walk from the 19th Street BART Station adjacent to the shores of Lake Merritt.
The office is also easily accessible via private transportation and a short walk to uptown's many excellent restaurants and shops.
Responsibilities: + Determines client requirements and develops suitable scopes of work, schedules, and budgets to help accomplish our client's objectives.
+ Develops and manages subsurface investigation and laboratory testing programs and may participate in field exploration activities.
+ Performs routine and complex data analysis and engineering calculations, such as slope stability, seepage, liquefaction potential, foundation support, and lateral earth pressures.
+ Prepares technical memorandums, letters, and reports.
+ Designs, installs, and maintains geotechnical instrumentation systems.
+ Works with client and other disciplines to prepare appropriate designs, as dictated by the scope of work.
+ Reviews contractor drawings, evaluates need for design changes, and makes appropriate geotechnical recommendations.
+ Consults with construction personnel concerning field conditions, sequencing, and scheduling of activities.
+ Ensures that production of reports, drawings, and specifications meets the scope, schedule, cost, and quality requirements and satisfies federal, state, and local requirements.
+ May provide direction to and supervision for junior level staff.
+ Communicates independently with clients.
+ Able to work in multi-disciplinary teams while leading tasks and project teams.
This position requires up to 30% travel to other Gannett Fleming offices, client offices, or project work sites and may include overnight travel.
Minimum Qualifications + B.S. Degree in Civil Engineering.
+ M.S. Degree in Geotechnical Engineering preferred.
+ Professional Engineer (P.E.) License required.
+ 5-10 years of direct work experience in geotechnical engineering.
+ Specialized experience in advanced geotechnical software applications (e.g., APILE, LPILE, SHAFT, GeoStudio, Slope/W, CLIQ, SETTLE3, gINT, and numerical calculations using spreadsheets).
+ Experience with MicroStation or AutoCAD preferred.
+ Knowledge of engineering concepts, theories, and practices as applied to geotechnical engineering, foundation systems, levees, dams, and waterfront structures.
+ Excellent oral and written communication skills.
+ Expertise with standard office software (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, etc.).
+ Some experience with management of small work groups and project tasks.

Hardware Verification Engineer I - Bothell, WA FUJIFILM Sonosite, Inc.
If you are looking for work that matters, you'll find it at FUJIFILM Sonosite.

As the creator of point of care ultrasound, we dedicate every day to the innovation and development of imaging solutions that enable clinicians to provide improved healthcare in leading institutions, underserved populations and communities in crisis around the globe.
At FUJIFILM Sonosite, we are in the relentless pursuit of answers that allow our customers to be confident that they are making the best clinical decisions for any patient, anywhere, anytime.
Members of the FUJIFILM Sonosite team embody our company values: Go boldly, Stay curious, Passion fuels us, Respect each other, Own it and Act with integrity.
Headquartered in Bothell, WA USA, FUJIFILM Sonosite is the proud recipient of numerous prestigious design awards and has in excess of 145 patents.
Our point of care ultrasound systems are sold in more than 100 countries.
Summary: The Hardware Verification Engineer I will support hardware verification activities for product development, quality and value engineering teams.
As part of the Hardware Verification team, you will be responsible for electromechanical product testing to ensure designs exceed customer expectations.
In this role you will develop, maintain and execute protocols to assess thermal, humidity, altitude, shock, vibration, safety, mechanical cycle-life, EMC and material compatibility performance.
Successful candidates will accurately document results, communicate findings and promote product quality.
Essential Job Functions: + Develop comprehensive knowledge of product requirements and performance acceptance criteria.
+ Create, update and release test plans and protocols to support product verification actions.
+ Maintain, organize and qualify test articles.
+ Ensure proper product configurations including hardware, software, accessories, modes and features.
+ Plan, schedule and execute projects for on/off site testing of thermal, humidity, altitude, shock, vibration, safety, mechanical cycle-life, EMC and material compatibility.
+ Transport systems to external test laboratories, install, operate and evaluate systems during testing.
+ Organize, document and communicate findings to program and engineering teams.
+ Troubleshoot and repair systems and equipment to the module level.
+ Support test equipment infrastructure and calibration.
Knowledge and Experience: + Requires 0-2 years relevant industry experience, preferably in an FDA or other regulated industry.
+ Associate degree in engineering field, BS in ME, EE or Biomedical preferred.
+ Knowledge of basic electronics and mechanical design concepts.
+ Knowledge performing or overseeing hardware tests involving environmental lab equipment (thermal, humidity, altitude and vibration).
+ Experience reading test plans, executing test protocols and organizing data for reports.
Skills and Abilities: + Ability to comprehend and execute electrical and mechanical engineering protocols.
+ Strong engineering documentation skills including data analysis, charting, logging, trending.
+ Comfortable working hands-on with electromechanical equipment and data acquisition systems.
+ Ability to work onsite and offsite at local testing laboratories.
+ Use of basic hand tools, moving and lifting of hardware is required.
+ Ability to lift 25 pounds, with or without accommodations.

What You Will Do This position will be filled at either the Instrumentation and Control Engineer 1 or 2 level, depending on the skills of the selected candidate.
Additional job responsibilities (outlined below) will be assigned if the candidate is hired at the higher level.
Instrumentation and Control - Electrical Engineer 1 ($90,000 - $147,100)
The position requires a skilled professional who applies principles and concepts in system and facility configuration and technical baseline management.

As part of the Engineering team within Science and Technology (ES-STO) you will modify, renovate, and design complete Building Automation Systems (BAS) including the specification and sizing of controllers, electromechanical devices, sensors, networks, and computer hardware, developing graphical and text-based interfaces for building automation systems, utilizing CAD to develop control drawing sets, and programming control algorithms.
Instrumentation and Control - Electrical Engineer 2 ($99,200 - $164,100)

In addition to what was outlined at the Instrumentation and Control Engineer 1, at this level you will be working as part of a design team assessing, maintaining, and upgrading facility systems at LANL.

Specific tasks will include developing contract documents consisting of drawings, specifications, calculations and special inspections in order to maintain the technical baseline for new and existing systems throughout the facility lifecycle.

This will require interfacing and coordinating with all stakeholders including other engineering disciplines, equipment manufacturers and customers during design and construction to establish design requirements, scope, cost, and modifications for projects.

What You Need Minimum Job Requirements: Fundamental knowledge of instrumentation and control engineering systems and calculations, applications of engineering methods, and application of computer-aided engineering tools to solve operations-based engineering problems.
Fundamental knowledge of engineering work, planning, construction, and control methods.
Fundamental knowledge of engineering maintenance techniques and construction methodologies.
Fundamental knowledge of engineering principles and procedures, design guides, appropriate standards, and administrative practices.
Knowledge of project and process engineering practices.

Additional Job Requirements for Instrumentation and Control Engineer 2: In addition to the requirements outlined above, qualification at the higher level requires: Demonstrated ability to prepare calculations, applications of engineering methods, and application of technology aided engineering tools to facility and operations-based engineering problems.

Working experience in creation of sequences of operation for the control of building systems, developing control schematics, wiring diagrams, programs, and graphics, testing of programming and interfaces prior to deployment, functional testing (commissioning) of building systems, and technical support during installation process.
Experience in leading projects, interfacing with customers, resolving questions and issues with project team and customers, and delivering construction documents on time.

Experience in supporting construction execution, including timely review of submittals, requests for information, design changes, aid in non-conformance issues, validation of commissioning activities and documentation, and producing accurate as-built documents.
Ability to collaboratively problem solve, show commitment, and function well in a team environment.

Education/Experience at Nuclear Facility Engineer 1 : Position requires a Bachelor's Degree in Engineering from an ABET-accredited college or university 2 and years of practical work experience necessary to perform the responsibilities outlined above.
NOTE: Candidates that meet the degree requirement, but do not meet the 2-year minimum experience requirement are encouraged to apply and may be considered for hire through an exception process.

Education/Experience at Nuclear Facility Engineer 2: Position requires a Bachelor's Degree in Engineering from an ABET-accredited college or university and a minimum of 3 years of practical work experience necessary to perform the responsibilities outlined above.
Advanced engineering or technical degree is highly desired.
Desired Qualifications: Current registration as an Engineer in Training (EIT) is desirable at the Nuclear Facility Engineer 2 level.
Basic knowledge of industry codes and standards (ISA, ISO, ANSI, IBC, NEC, NFPA, etc.)
Familiar with producing designs utilizing AutoCAD tools and work processes.
Familiar with Engineering Standards and Conduct of Engineering along with industry, regulatory, or Department of Energy/National Nuclear Security Administration (DOE/NNSA) codes and standards.
Experience with BAS Software, associated engineering tools, graphic software (Adobe Illustrator, Photoshop, etc.), and Microsoft Visio.
Experience with Automated Logic and Phoenix software, including WebCtrl, SiteBuilder, ViewBuilder, LogicBuilder, InterOp 3.02, Alert, Draw, EDB, Eikon, Supervision, and Accel Works.
Work Location: This position is physically located in Los Alamos, NM.
This position requires employees to be onsite for work with an optional remote day at the manger's discretion.

Position commitment: Regular appointment employees are required to serve a period of continuous service in their current position in order to be eligible to apply for posted jobs throughout the Laboratory.
If an employee has not served the time required, they may only apply for Laboratory jobs with the documented approval of their Division Leader.
The position commitment for this position is 1 year.
Where You Will Work Engineering Services (ES) Division applies capabilities to enable the Laboratory's scientific and national security mission.
Within ES, the Science and Technology Operations (STO) Engineering Group is a multi-disciplinary organization consisting of collaborative Design and System Engineering Teams.
Collectively, these teams enable the STO Facility Operations Directorate (FOD) mission across nearly three million square feet of mixed-use office, laboratory, research, and production space.
With over one hundred facilities in 11 Technical Areas, STO mission work spans the majority of Laboratory Directorates.
Located in beautiful northern New Mexico, Los Alamos National Laboratory (LANL) is a multidisciplinary research institution engaged in strategic science on behalf of national security.
Our generous benefits package includes: PPO or High Deductible medical insurance with the same large nationwide network.
Dental and vision insurance.
Free basic life and disability insurance.
Paid childbirth and parental leave.
Award-winning 401(k) (6% matching plus 3.5% annually).
Learning opportunities and tuition assistance.
Flexible schedules and time off (PTO and holidays).
Onsite gyms and wellness programs.
Extensive relocation packages (outside a 50 mile radius).
Additional Details Directive 206.2 - Employment with Triad requires a favorable decision by NNSA indicating employee is suitable under NNSA Supplemental Directive 206.2.
Please note that this requirement applies only to citizens of the United States.
Foreign nationals are subject to a similar requirement under DOE Order 142.3A.
Clearance: Q (Position will be cleared to this level).
Selected applicants will be subject to a background investigation conducted by or on behalf of the Federal Government, and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified matter.
This position requires a Q clearance.
and obtaining such clearance requires US Citizenship except in extremely rare circumstances.
Dependent upon the position, additional authorization to access classified information may be required, which may or may not be available to dual citizens.
Receipt of a Q clearance and additional access authorization ultimately is a decision of the Federal Government and not of Triad.
Eligibility requirements: To obtain a clearance, an individual must be at least 18 years of age; U.S. citizenship is required except in very limited circumstances.
See DOE Order 472.2 for additional information.
New-Employment Drug Test: The Laboratory requires successful applicants to complete a new-employment drug test and maintains a substance abuse policy that includes random drug testing.
Although New Mexico and other states have legalized the use of marijuana, use and possession of marijuana remain illegal under federal law.
A positive drug test for marijuana will result in termination of employment, even if the use was pre-offer.
Regular position: Term status Laboratory employees applying for regular-status positions are converted to regular status.
Internal Applicants: Regular appointment employees who have served the required period of continuous service in their current position are eligible to apply for posted jobs throughout the Laboratory.
If an employee has not served the required period of continuous service, they may only apply for Laboratory jobs with the documented approval of their Division Leader.
Please refer to Policy Policy P701 for applicant eligibility requirements.
Equal Opportunity: Los Alamos National Laboratory is an equal opportunity employer and supports a diverse and inclusive workforce.

All employment practices are based on qualification and merit, without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, religion, age, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation or preference, marital status or spousal affiliation, physical or mental disability, medical conditions, pregnancy, status as a protected veteran, genetic information, or citizenship within the limits imposed by federal laws and regulations.

Machine Learning App Development Engineer - SIML, ISE Santa Clara Valley (Cupertino),California,United States
Machine Learning and AI
Do you think Computer Vision and Machine Learning can change the world?
Do you think it can transform the way millions of people collect, discover and share the most special moments of their lives?
We truly believe it can.
And we are looking for hardworking engineers who can contribute to building the ecosystem of tooling necessary to create these exciting technologies.
We are the System Intelligent and Machine Learning (SIML) group that provides foundational computer vision and machine learning technologies to Apple's ecosystem.
Our team combines research and development in a dynamic and exciting environment and delivers robust solutions that are implemented across all of Apple products.
Proven success in building useful iOS applications and tools
Proven knowledge of Swift and Objective-C, and a high degree of comfort with Apple development paradigms
Experience working within a Machine Learning team, or a strong desire to learn about Machine Learning
Good interpersonal skills with success in projects involving multiple teams
In this role as the successful candidate, you will be crafting apps to support product-focused machine learning projects.
Your focus will be to build a variety of iOS tools that will be used internally, and also potentially by Apple customers.

One category is applications for data acquisition, and the data collected will feed into exciting new machine learning projects across several domains including computer vision, natural language processing, human-computer interaction and text recognition.
Another category involves creatively designing and implementing new interfaces for studying failure cases for machine learning projects.
You may also help with high-profile demonstration apps to show off new technologies, or dive into unfamiliar codebases to help converge our software releases.
The ideal candidate will have significant experience crafting and implementing user interfaces and business logic for apps on iOS.
In this role, you bring needed understanding of how a user interface design can make or break adoption, which is essential for data acquisition applications and tools.
You enjoy variety, and are passionate about working on new things on a frequent basis.
You love working in projects involving several teams, and driving solutions that take multiple partners into account.

You are either a machine learning industry veteran, or simply a stellar engineer wanting to expand your horizons and learn more about the nitty gritty of how machine learning projects get off the ground from inception to release!
Bachelors, Masters, or Ph.D. in Computer Science, or equivalent related fields, or similar proven experience.

At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on revolutionary systems that impact people's lives around the world today, and for generations to come.

Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history - from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to landing on the moon.
We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have fun along the way.
Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and bringing your whole self to work - and we have an insatiable drive to do what others think is impossible.
Our employees are not only part of history, they're making history.
Northrop Grumman Mission Systems (NGMS) Advanced Capabilities division is leading the development of the next generation of high-performance computing.
Superconducting electronics forms the core of our technology, with a focus on energy-efficient computation using our patented superconducting digital logic technology, Reciprocal Quantum Logic (RQL).
The Advanced Capabilities division seeks experienced RF Engineers - Modeling, Simulation & Analysis to develop these technologies into high-performance computing systems.
You'll work in a fast-paced team environment alongside physicists, design engineers, and superconducting foundry engineers to make these technologies a reality.

How you will contribute to the Mission: + Contribute directly, working on design and analysis of signal integrity and electromagnetic effects in highly complex high frequency, high dynamic range mixed signal systems in a very collaborative and innovative research and development environment.
+ Perform analytical studies of electronic systems (integrated circuits, chip-level packaging, interposers, printed circuit boards, connectors, etc.) to support design tradeoffs.
+ Design and analysis activities include electromagnetic modeling (e.g. SSN, ISI, crosstalk, EMC/EMI) for packaging parasitic estimation, associated interconnect, PCBA and filters.
+ All design, testing and verification efforts ensure simulated and measured results meet desired design targets, and continually improve simulation-measurement correlation.
+ Develop new test and simulation methods as necessary to support the above activities when demands exceed the state of the art.
+ Create new design strategies where possible to support functional requirements while meeting SI, PI and EM goals.
+ Deep understanding of RF/EMC measurement and analysis (s-parameters, eigenmodes, TDR, FFT, IF, etc.).
+ Work closely with other domain experts performing related functional analyses (e.g. Mechanical design & analysis, circuit design & test, thermal analysis, etc.).
+ Willingness to continually expand the knowledge base of yourself and the team (e.g. examine new research, relevant papers, seek applicable methodologies in adjacent applications, etc.).
+ Coordinate related technical team activities.
+ Present details of work to colleagues during design reviews.
+ Create and manage work plans to meet or exceed schedule deadlines.
+ Provide written and oral summaries of work performed as needed (e.g. for reports).
This position will serve on-site in Linthicum, MD or Annapolis Junction, MD.
This position will be filled at the RF Engineer - Modeling, Simulation & Analysis level based on the qualifications below:
Basic Qualifications: + Bachelors degree in a STEM related field with 2 or more years' of relevant experience required.
Masters degree and 0 years of relevant experience.
+ Working knowledge of CAD/simulation tools (e.g. HFSS, CST Studio, Sonnet, ADS, HSPICE, SI-Wave, Sigrity) in support of design and analysis.
+ Experience with high frequency measurement techniques in frequency and time domains for characterizing various interconnect features such as insertion loss, return loss, impedance, and crosstalk.
+ Understanding of electromagnetic theory, transmission line theory, network analysis, and high-speed measurement, calibration, and de-embedding techniques.
+ Knowledge of fundamental electrical engineering and circuit design principles.
+ Use of Microsoft Office tools (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and proficiency in writing for reporting.
+ Active U.S. TS/SCI with Poly Security Clearance for which U.S. Citizenship is a requirement.
Preferred Qualifications: + Ansys HFSS modeling for RF packaging effects.
+ Experience with spectrum and network analyzer techniques for EMC measurements.
+ Familiarity with packaging technology (e.g. ceramic and laminate chip-level packages, printed circuit boards, interposers, wire bonding, etc.).
+ Familiarity with cryogenic test stands, superconductivity, mechanical CTE.
This position reports to Linthicum, MD, USA, however, this position can also be worked from Annapolis Junction, MD, MD, USA.

Lockheed Martin Missiles & Fire Control (MFC) is seeking a motivated and driven Supplier Quality Engineer (SQE) for a position based in Grand Prairie, TX.

The position requires previous quality engineering experience in developing and reviewing quality standards, methods, work instructions and procedures for the development and production of manufactured and procured products.
Individual should be a self-starter who can work autonomously with minimal direction in a fast-paced dynamic environment.
This position will collaborate between various functions/resources/locations to assure compliance and continuous improvement.

The scope of responsibilities for this role will include: Root cause, corrective, and preventive action investigation / determinations / validations and documentation, performing quality data analysis, conducting / coordinating process and product evaluations, identifying risks / opportunities and developing / overseeing improvement and engagement plans.
Perform technical evaluations including product requirements, specifications, models / designs, drawings, and procedures.
Collaborate with program management, engineering, manufacturing, supply chain and customers on quality related issues to ensure quality standards are in place.
Engages in product failure investigations, material review board decisions and corrective / preventive action.
Ensures corrective measures meet acceptable reliability standards and/or are compliant with requirements.
Develops strategies and systems designed to improve internal and / or supplier performance and productivity.
Evaluates quality systems for deficiency identification and correction.
Performs assessments and audits on processes and procedures to ensure compliance to specifications, engineering drawings, procedures and ISO-9001 / AS9100.
The position requires about 25% travel but will vary with business needs.
Basic Qualifications: Bachelor's degree from an accredited college in a STEM discipline with related professional experience.
Must be a US Citizen and have the ability to obtain a security clearance.
Ability to read and interpret blueprints and specifications and apply knowledge in troubleshooting technical issues and in developing/validating solutions.

Experience in quality engagement and oversight with ability to identify root cause and execute on corrective actions utilizing quantitative / qualitative analytical capabilities and data driven methodologies.
Knowledgeable of AS9100 and ISO 9001 Quality Management Systems standards and implementation of Quality Management System.
Experience with increasing production rates.
Effective communication skills including written, oral, listening, technical writing.
Ability to travel.
Desired Skills: Quality Engineering or Supplier Quality experience.
Experience with developing and reviewing Quality Standards, methods, work instructions and procedures for inspection.
An understanding of the Missiles & Fire Control (MFC) SAP and Procure to Pay (P2P) business systems.
Experience with performing/reviewing First Article Inspections to AS9102 requirements and / or Production Part Approval Process documentation.
ASQ Certified Quality Engineer (CQE).
Lean / Six Sigma Green or Black Belt certification.
Experience working with Government customers.
Understanding of Geometric Dimensioning & Tolerance (GD&T).
Security Clearance Statement: This position requires a government security clearance, you must be a US Citizen for consideration.
Clearance Level: Secret.
Other Important Information You Should Know.

Should this match be identified you may be contacted for this and future openings.

The specific weekly schedule will be discussed during the hiring process.
Work Schedules: Lockheed Martin supports a variety of alternate work schedules that provide additional flexibility to our employees.
Schedules range from standard 40 hours over a five day work week while others may be condensed.
These condensed schedules provide employees with additional time away from the office and are in addition to our Paid Time off benefits.
Schedule for this Position: 4x10 hour day, 3 days off per week.

API Heat Transfer is looking for people who enjoy being part of transformation.

What You Will Do: The Manufacturing Engineer writes programs for CNC manufacturing equipment and create shop routers.

What you will bring: + Bachelor's degree in technical field or equivalent combination of education and experience preferred.
Associate degree required.
+ At least 2 years' manufacturing experience with knowledge of machine tools.
+ Must be able to read drawings.
+ Proficient in computer assisted manufacturing (CAM).

Philips is a global leader in health technology, committed to improving billions of lives worldwide and striving to make the world healthier and more sustainable through innovation.

We are 80,000, wonderfully unique individuals, with two things in common: An unwavering sense of purpose and a relentless determination to deliver on our customers' needs.

The world and our customers' needs are changing faster than ever before and while we are proud of what we do already, we know we can do more.

In this role, you have the opportunity to make life better work on the development of Intravascular Ultrasound Systems.
As a member of an international cross-functional team, you work closely together with hardware engineers, transducer engineers, system engineers, and software engineers.

You are responsible for + Be a key contributor in the innovation, development and implementation of novel signal and image processing algorithms to support intravascular ultrasound imaging and vascular functional measurement technologies + Collaborate with cross functional teams to define user clinical needs.

Tune intravascular ultrasound systems for optimum image quality.
Support new product development projects and sustaining projects while adhering to quality control and regulatory procedures.
Plan and lead/execute laboratory research.
Participate in clinical human and animal imaging studies for assessment and testing of new technologies and products.
Collaborate with marketing and product management organizations to define new feature requirements to meet specific clinical applications and market needs.
Provide technical expertise to support other departments.
Identify opportunities for and drive internal process improvements.
You are part of A global, cross-functional technical team responsible for the design, development, and implementation of Intravascular Ultrasound products.
You are a member of the Ultrasound Engineering team.

PhD Preferred.
3+ years of experience in the field of medical imaging research and/or product development.
Ultrasound imaging preferred.
Expertise in MATLAB.
Capability to work in a fast paced, regulated environment, with strict adherence to a quality system.
Demonstrated skill in solving problems.
Adaptability in the face of ambiguous and evolving situations.

Ability to communicate effectively, both oral and written, in order to establish and maintain cooperative working relationships with persons contacted in the course of performing assigned duties including Company management and outside business associates.
In return, we offer you A chance to serve a bigger purpose.

At Philips, our mission to improve the lives of 3 billion people per year by 2030, and every day, we move closer to achieving our goal by creating cutting-edge solutions that lead to confident diagnosis, improved care, and increased quality of life for patients drive us.
We enable our employees to create a legacy in life through their work and support their development through people-centric learning, total rewards and personalized development planning programs.

Our business provides unique opportunities to develop innovative enterprise software solutions and deliver meaningful solutions in the healthcare space and this new position is a unique opportunity to shape the next generation solutions we are developing.

How we work at Philips Our newly adopted hybrid work concept fuses flexibility with collaboration to deliver great outcomes for our people and our customers.

We are embracing an approach wherein we spend more time together than apart - which for full-time employees translates to an average of at least 3 days working from the office and up to 2 days from home - for our hybrid roles.
Hybrid work flexibility means people can meet the changing demands of work and home in the most balanced, productive, and healthy way.

Our hybrid working model is defined in 3 ways: We believe in the importance of impactful collaboration: There's a certain energy when everyone's in the same room that can heighten idea generation and creative friction needed for problem-solving.
We embrace flexibility: Choosing where, when, and how to work can vary according to task and team schedules.
Flexibility isn't office or online, it means choosing the space that works best for you, your teams, and our customers on a case-by-case basis.
We want to be at our best: The way we work, and our workspaces are designed to support our well-being, offer career advancement opportunities, and enable us to be at our best.
Why should you join Philips?
Working at Philips is more than a job.
It's a calling to create a healthier society through meaningful work, focused on innovative, customer-first health technology solutions.
Help us improve the health and well-being of billions of people, every year.
Ultimately creating a career that no one could have planned for.

Visit our careers website to explore what it's like working at Philips, read stories from our employee blog, find information about our recruitment process and answers to some frequently asked questions.

Cellular 4G/5G Firmware Power Verification Engineer San Diego,California,United States Hardware
Do you have a passion for invention and self-challenge?
As part of an outstanding modem team, we'll craft powerful embedded firmware that deliver more performance in our products than ever before!
We'll work across subject areas to transform improved hardware elements into a single, coordinated design.
Join us, and you'll help us innovate new wireless systems technologies that continually outperform the previous iterations.

By collaborating with other product development groups across Apple, you'll push the industry boundaries of what wireless systems can do and improve the product experience for our customers across the world!

As a Cellular 5G/4G Firmware Power Verification Engineer, you will be at the center of the embedded 5G/4G/multimode cellular firmware effort within a silicon design group responsible for crafting and productizing groundbreaking cellular SoCs.

This position requires someone comfortable will all aspects of embedded firmware verification, that thrives in a multi-functional organization, is not afraid to debate ideas openly, and is flexible enough to shift on requirements.
Minimum BS and 10+ years of relevant industry experience
Experience on working with power optimization methodologies as well as hands-on experience with power measurement tools, preferably in cellular technologies
Ability to work multi-functionally with different teams implement power verification test plan that will help achieve the outstanding modem targets

Knowledge in wireless systems, 4G/5G physical layer, protocol stack and procedures, power measurement and modem architecture, in particular C-DRX, Airplane modes, different sleep idle state transitions
Validated understanding of different interfaces like PCIe, USB, MPHY based RF-BB interconnects, frequency and voltage management and clocking schemes
Understanding of SoC architectures, Fabrics, DDRs and DMAs will be an added plus
Shown track-record of innovation and hands-on experience in power measurement setup and test methodology
Strong understanding of automation tools and scripting languages such as Python, C/C++, Java (a plus)
Strong understanding multiple 4G/5G signaling and physical layer test equipment along with their automation interfaces
Experience with network emulators, silicon prototyping, emulation systems, and virtual platforms a plus
Work closely with the product teams to define, implement and complete power test plan according to cellular modem power requirements
Study and analysis of post-Silicon power measurement data and waveforms to debug issues and identify potential optimization opportunities
Design, setup and maintain power test platforms including integration & bring up DUT
Active participation in modem power measurement, solving and optimization
Work with system engineers and FW developers to understand details of system design, modem architecture and FW implementation to give to power optimization, issue triaging & debugging
