Cirrus Aircraft is currently hiring an Aircraft Systems Engineer focused on Powerplant Systems.

An engineer in this role is responsible for design, development, integration, and certification with engine and/or propeller manufacturers along with systems such as fire extinguishing, fire detection, engine controls, engine indications, powerplant cooling, fuel systems, induction, and exhaust on both the SR and SF platforms as well as new projects.
Candidates will also be responsible for coordinating development and system integration work with subcontractors and external suppliers.
Duties and Responsibilities/Essential Functions + Interface with other aircraft disciplines, including structural and electrical disciplines, across the Cirrus Aircraft platform.
+ Work with a multi-discipline team on powerplant system design development.
+ Identify, select, and coordinate with component and system suppliers.
+ Active involvement in development and certification of powerplant systems under FAR Part 23, Part 25, or Part 33.
+ Research industry guidance documents for best practices, e.g., SAE.
+ Create 3D models and drawings of powerplant systems in Creo.
+ Author and check documents including test plans and reports, certification reports, and other engineering documents.
+ Perform trade studies involving weight, cost, reliability, and manufacturability.
+ Must have strong written and verbal communication skills on technical issues and have a high level of initiative to fill gaps when necessary.
+ Complete project assignments and take responsibility for designs and design outcomes.
+ Proficient in Microsoft Office (Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Teams).
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential function satisfactorily.
The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.
Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
+ Bachelor's degree in mechanical engineering or aerospace engineering.
+ Experience in powerplant systems is desirable but not required.
+ Experience working on piston engines.
+ Experience with Windchill PDM and Creo/Pro-E.
+ Familiarity with SAE ARP4754A & ARP4761 guidelines and procedures and ASTM standards.
+ Experience working on type certification of an aircraft from start to finish under any of 14 CFR Part 23/25/27/33/35/36 or equivalent regulations.
+ Familiarity with DO-160 environmental testing.
Demonstrated ability to work cross-functionally with Chief Engineers and management peer groups.
+ Out of the box thinking to deliver required technical solutions to meet program goals.
+ Show initiative and ability to work in absence of a defined process.
+ Excellent technical writing, presentation, and interpersonal communication skills.
+ Sound judgement and decision-making skills.
+ Able to work with program managers and project leaders to develop and hold accountability to schedules.
+ Ability to efficiently learn new skills and manage multiple tasks.
To perform the job successfully, an individual should demonstrate the following competencies:
+ Situational Adaptability: Adapts approach and demeanor in real time to match shifting demands of different situations.
+ Manages Complexity: Makes sense of complex, high quantity, and sometimes, contradictory information to effectively solve problems.
+ Communicates Effectively: Develops and delivers multi-mode communications that convey a clear understanding of the unique needs of different audiences.
+ Ensures Accountability: Holds self accountable to meet commitments.

The Cyber Technical Operations Engineer for the Joint Cyber Training Enterprise (JCTE) will provide subject matter expertise for Tier 1 and Tier II help desk support, as well as build our NETOPS maturity.
The incumbent will have the opportunity to grow into this mid-level role and learn cyber range design, implementation, validation, and execution.

The candidate will provide technical expertise across a broad spectrum of IT and cybersecurity products, tools, architectures, and implementations, with the ability to use that expertise to design and implement cyber ranges.
Also, the candidate must support individual training, large scale collective training and address operational mission rehearsal requirements for the Cyber National Mission Forces (CNMF), at USCC.
The candidate will work closely with customer and third-party organizations and must be able to respond to ad-hoc technical requirements while synchronizing priorities across the enterprise.
The candidate must thrive in high pressure situations.

+ As a Cyber Range and NETOPS engineer for JCTE, the candidate will provide technical expertise to support the development and execution of large-scale cyber exercises and multi-spectrum cyber operations.
The candidate will support the execution of cyber training and mission rehearsal events and help establish an internal NETOPS capability within JCTE.
+ Integrate into a highly talented team of seasoned cyber operators and provide cyber range expertise to enable DCO and OCO operations for USCC as well as across the service components.
+ Knowledge of the Joint Events Life Cycle (JELC) and an intermediate knowledge of defensive and offensive cyber tools.
+ Working knowledge of networking, to include: DNS, routing, basic to advanced TCP/IP skills and troubleshooting.
+ Background in VMware, Net App, and RedHat Linux (RHEL).
+ Support cyber range event design and execution.
+ Provides technical support and quality assurance of platform resources and services.
+ Coordinates between platform developer and training audience on requirements and service degradation.
+ Tier I and II help desk services.
+ Addresses basic to advances technical and engineering problems.
+ Account and platform management, as well as capability integration.
+ Facilitates Content and Training Management with the user base.
+ Manages utilization of both classified and unclassified PCTE instances and associated resources.
+ Coordinates between platform developer and Help Desk escalation and ticket resolution.
+ Provide subject matter expertise on architecture, authentication and system security.
+ Drive continuous process improvement across all event activities.
+ Provides expert-level IT, virtual environment, and network support functions.
+ Must be a self-starter in a fast-paced environment and able to work with a range of engineers holding a diverse set of skills at differing levels of experience.
+ Effective written and oral communication with multiple levels of leadership involving both business and technical sides of the business.
+ Be sensitive and flexible to the needs and requirements of the customer.
+ Familiar to Intermediate knowledge of DNS: Authoritative vs. Recursive servers, SOA, NS, MX, A, and CNAME records.

+ Familiar with Security Onion or SPLUNK: interface requirements, scalability landmines, Enterprise configurations (sensor and master). VMWare port properties and how they are tied to sensor ports and promiscuous modes.
+ Prioritize multiple tasks, projects, and demands.
+ Interact with vendors/users/customers and developers to understand needs and operational requirements changes that will impact the production environment.
+ Ability to solve technical problems involving a variety of integrated software and hardware platforms.
+ 5+ years of experience with cyber training, validation exercises, and NETOPS experience is a plus.
+ Current DoD 8570 IAT Level II or greater certification such as Security+, CCNA, CISSP or other equivalent certification.
+ Associates degree in a technical discipline such as information technology, computer science, systems or software engineering from an accredited college or university.
+ TS SCI security clearance with a current CI or FS polygraph.

Meta is seeking a Connectivity Engineer to join the Design Engineering and Construction (DEC) team.
Our data centers are the foundation upon which our innovative services are delivered, and our rapidly scaling infrastructure operates.
The team lights up Meta 's global data centers, delivering the physical infrastructure that connects the world to the videos, feeds, and other information stored on Meta 's server banks.
The DEC Connectivity Engineer will provide site level support to ensure DEC telecommunication projects are being executed on schedule, within budget and at the level of quality specified.
Connectivity Engineer will be the key point of contact for managing the full project life-cycle including project kick-off all the way through production turnover into operations.
DEC Connectivity Engineer is highly collaborative with cross-functional partners at the Data Center Headquarters, our on-site contractor, and other data centers globally.
Required Skills: Connectivity Engineer Responsibilities:
1. Project Planning & Control - Create, maintain, and report on site project and program scope, schedules and milestones.
Work closely with site project management team throughout the project lifecycle from the creation of project and program plans through project close out.
2. Learnings - Continually review ongoing projects for efficiencies in schedule, budget, and opportunities to enable cross-functional partners to be successful.
Document data points to assist with field coordination of projects.
Support development of project management best practices and initiatives, coordinating SOPs/SIPs with vendors, and participating in global and regional standards.
Coordinate lessons learned with the DEC Center of Excellence.
3. Forecasting - Support project controls team with forecasting and budget efforts as required.
Share current project status with upstream and downstream partners, ensuring crisp and complete handoffs between teams.
4. Technical Reviews - Establish milestones for equipment purchase and track and report against these milestones.
Assist with the selection and review of a contractor to support the structured cabling work within a data center.
5. Metrics - Report progress and risks on site projects and other initiatives to key stakeholders.
6. Workflow - Work with installation partners to establish and track milestones.
Conduct pre-project planning, project handoffs, and ensure design delivery and verification.
Identify and respond to project risks and high-priority issues rapidly and effectively through effective action and appropriate escalation.
Track and manage project change order requests.
7. Vendor Field Management - Responsible for all connectivity activities within construction, projects on site including tracking and reporting actual progress related to schedule expectations.

Set and communicate clear expectations together with the immediate site team, build key relationships with our installation partners and drive a culture of best practice, safe working environment and execute to a vision of 'right first time.'
8. Quality Assurance - Perform physical inspections to ensure vendor work meets DEC quality standards throughout the lifecycle of the data center.
Validate physical installs, test reports, build accuracy, material and local code compliance including constructability reviews on multiple design phases.

9. Technical Field Lead - Technical lead for industry and Meta standards, responsible to lead product evaluation, design, and installation methods in the field including scope clarification, design and installation details as the owner of the Request for Information process.
10. Technical Coordination - Develop solutions to in-field scope-gap or clash issues.
Partner with DEC design and engineering teams to digitally support design reviews, BOM reviews, and as-built drawing validations.
11. Communications & Cross functional team engagement - Liaise with construction partners to ensure deliverables are met during new builds and retrofits.
Coordinate with logistics partners, vendors, and suppliers to ensure a smooth end to end flow of materials as needed.
Work closely with the relevant teams to proactively communicate progress and project risks and initiatives to key stakeholders.
12. Safety - Ensure that vendors adhere to safety obligations in accordance with local regulations and DEC Safety best practices.
Lead a 'safety first' culture, with open and transparent communication.
Acknowledging good EHS practices.

23. Experience with outside plant cabling (OSP) deployments including OTDR/OLTS testing.

Kiewit Power Engineers has an immediate opening for a motivated Senior Overhead Transmission Engineer to join our growing Power Delivery team!

As part of this team of highly specialized design professionals, you will support a variety of transmission and distribution projects ranging from 12kV to 500kV in both engineering detailed design and Engineer, Procure, Construct (EPC) projects for clients throughout the country.

You will be part of a team that supports all aspects of the project execution process by performing innovative design engineering through brainstorming conceptual designs, performing and/or reviewing final design and deliverables, scheduling tasks to meet client needs, as well as mitigating risk to ensure smooth and safe construction operations.
Kiewit Power Delivery is a full-service engineering and construction solutions provider operating across North America.

Our experience and expertise span all aspects of the transmission and distribution market from high voltage overhead and underground transmission to distribution and automation design and construction capabilities.
With these broad capabilities, we operate in the electric utility, renewable energy, industrial, and oil, gas markets.
As part of Kiewit, we are integrated with 135 years of construction and engineering experience that provides holistic solutions, differentiating our team from the rest of the industry.
Our rapidly growing power delivery business has opened new locations across North America to strengthen our market presence while executing work within the communities that we live.
We have invested in industry leading design technology and platforms while also expanding our construction equipment fleet with the most advanced, and safest equipment on the market.
We are committed to building upon our history as one of the safest companies to work for by equipping our craft with the best tooling and safety programs available.
We are an innovative team that prides itself on continuous improvement and always delivering on our commitments to our clients and ourselves.

Our staff collaborates with Kiewit's vast internal network of resources that span heavy civil and infrastructure, vertical and commercial buildings, mining, as well our oil and gas and power generation markets, to drive safe and cost-effective solutions that achieve client expectations and further Kiewit's legacy of excellence.
On our team, you'll have the opportunity to see more, touch more, and do more than you ever imagined.
Working hard will not only bring you satisfaction from a job well done, but it will help propel your career forward faster than you might expect.
Kiewit's culture encourages training, developing your skills, and tailoring your experience and knowledge to allow you to take on projects that impact millions across North America.
With top-notch health benefits, a wealth-building 401k plan, and unbeatable growth opportunities, by joining Kiewit, you're ensuring a lifetime of success.
This position is based out of our office in Raleigh, NC.
Relocation assistance is available for well-qualified candidates.

Develop and review comprehensive construction packages for internal construction crews and client contractors that include plan & profiles, staking sheets, stringing tables, bill of materials, structure details, phasing drawings, foundation drawings, and installation specifications.

BAE Systems is seeking an exceptional Senior Systems Engineering Manager for an exciting opportunity to support the United States Space Force's (USSF) Satellite Control Network (SCN) as its Chief Engineer.

The SCN provides highly reliable and secure data transfer, telemetry, tracking, command, control, and communications (TT&C3) for more than 195 Department of Defense (DoD), National Reconnaissance Office (NRO), civil, and allied satellites.
Successful candidates will demonstrate their ability to lead a team of professionals conducting Systems Engineering, Integration and Test activities for current and future SCN configurations.

The SCN Chief Engineer works with the SCN Program Manager to oversee the technical planning, system integration, verification and validation, evaluation of alternatives including cost, risk, supportability and analyses for the SCN.
Analyses are performed at all levels of total system product to include concept, design, fabrication, test, installation, operation, maintenance and disposal.

This position ensures the logical and systematic conversion of product requirements into total systems solutions, translating customer requirements into hardware/software specifications that support SCN logistics, depot level maintenance, sustainment, sustainment systems engineering support, cyber security, factory compatibility testing, modifications and solutions development.
Successful candidates will also: + Be highly customer-oriented and always working to anticipate the customer s needs and work hard to exceed their expectations.
Apply Systems Engineering Principles in the development of strategic plans meeting customer requirements.
Assist customers in the development of current and future IT system requirements.
Evaluate plans and criteria for technical activities and recommending alternatives as required to comply with customer and company obligations.
+ Operate in a highly collaborative, team-focused manner and love working with a greater team to further the organization's higher-level goals and objectives.
Direct project activities or segments of major projects responsible for achievement of schedule, cost, and technical performance objectives.
Prepare project execution plan and identify technical and business resources needed.
Review status of projects and budgets, manage schedules and prepare status reports.
Assess issues and develop resolutions to meet productivity, quality, and client-satisfaction goals and objectives.
Provide program management, technical and analytical guidance to project team.

+ Be an experienced and skilled leader and communicator willing to meet challenges head-on and balance mission priorities across the team while successfully maintaining personnel and customer relationships.
+ Attend conferences and meetings to represent assigned activity.
Developing working group meeting agendas, preparing and consolidating briefing materials, meeting minutes, and answers to action items assigned by other agencies or organizations.
Conduct research in areas which require a high level of expertise and knowledge in areas of specialization and some related fields.
Maintaining knowledge in area of specialization and awareness of developments in the remaining related fields, including extensive contributions to proposal efforts.
+ Handle other duties as assigned.
Pursuant to Government contract, this position requires US Citizenship status.
This position is located in Colorado Springs, Colorado and is not conducive to regular telework schedules.
The position requires frequent visits to additional BAE Systems and/or Customer locations.

Custom Circuits Design Verification Engineer Austin,Texas,United States Hardware
Does making the next great technology product excite you?
At Apple, we work every single day to craft products that enrich peoples lives.
Our new ideas have a way of becoming great products, services, and customer experiences very quickly.
Design Verification Engineers at Apple are responsible for verifying the functionality and performance of Apples premier SoCs that make their way into Apple products.
We are looking for a Design Verification Engineer who will enable bug-free first silicon for all the Digital custom IPs we deliver to the many SoCs that Apple produces.
+ DV skills including, but not limited to, random verification process, functional coverage, code coverage, assertion methodology & philosophy.
+ Knowledge of Verilog/System Verilog, digital simulation and debug tools.
+ At least one scripting language, such as Perl or Python.
+ Knowledge of behavioral and structural RTL coding especially as it pertains to SRAM, register file, and other custom circuit designs.
+ Plus knowledge of FPGA and emulation challenges related to RTL coding and verification is desirable.
+ Knowledge of industry standard design tools, such as ESPCV and/or LEC.
+ Knowledge of regression and revision control tools.
+ DFT (ATPG/MBIST) knowledge is desirable.
In this role as a Custom Circuits DV Engineer, you will be working with the digital custom circuits team to ensure that all pre-silicon deliveries of custom IPs to all Apple SoC's are bug-free.
This requires you to review design and architecture specifications and understand the use cases and corner conditions.
Furthermore, you will be required to translate these specifications into test benches that include all the respective components such as stimulus, checkers, assertions, trackers, and coverage.
You will also work closely with both the custom circuit designers and RTL designers to understand the functionality and performance goals of the design.
We also require additional responsibilities such as running and triaging regressions, tracking bugs, and analyzing coverage to achieve high quality results.
In this highly visible role, you will be at the center of a SoC design effort collaborating with all teams, with a critical impact on getting bug-free functional products to market quickly.
BS degree

Ameresco, Inc. (NYSE:AMRC) is a leading cleantech integrator and renewable energy asset developer, owner and operator.
Our comprehensive portfolio includes energy efficiency, infrastructure upgrades, asset sustainability and renewable energy solutions delivered to clients throughout North America and Europe.
Our solutions range from upgrades to facility's energy infrastructure to the development, construction and operation of renewable energy plants combined with tailored financial solutions.
We foster an entrepreneurial, collaborative, and forward-thinking culture that thrives with innovation, diversity of thought, and inclusion.
We are excited with all that the future holds for our industry, planet, and communities.
Ameresco has a new opportunity for an Energy Engineer to join our Measurement & Verification Team.

The engineer will be responsible for providing technical expertise to ensure our energy efficiency and renewable energy projects are generating the energy and water savings that we guarantee to our customers through Energy Savings Performance Contracts (ESPC) on federal projects throughout the United States.
This position can be based at either our Columbia, MD, or Knoxville, TN office.
Responsibilities Gather site information including commodity meter data, BAS trend data, PV production data, and CHP plant performance data;

Schedule and conduct site surveys of HVAC systems, boiler plants, chiller plants, PV arrays, and compressed air systems to verify equipment is performing as intended to achieve project energy savings;
Analyze and evaluate data to verify energy savings are being achieved using spreadsheet-based energy calculations, and to a lesser extent building energy models such as eQuest;
Write quarterly and annual Measurement & Verification reports to summarize findings of surveys and analysis.
Reports must clearly convey methodologies used to verify energy savings and any deficiencies that were found to result in reduced savings;
Make recommendations to customers of operational changes that would result in additional energy savings;
As required, coordinate assistance with Ameresco Operations & Maintenance staff and service contractors to address any identified deficiencies;
Assist project development teams in creating M&V protocols for new projects;
Cultivate and foster customer relationships;
Perform other duties as required.
Minimum Qualifications: BSME or equivalent four-year technical engineering degree.
Minimum two years' experience performing energy savings analysis for HVAC systems, boiler plants, chiller plants, or compressed air systems.
EIT, or on track to obtain EIT within a year of hire.
Ability to review confidential US security information.
Additional Qualifications: Strong analytical capability in regard to evaluating HVAC system trend data to verify proper operation of energy-savings control strategies.
Ability to analyze and quantify energy savings in projects involving chiller and boiler plants, motors, compressors, VSDs, HVAC retrofit, controls, and distributed generation.
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel.
Excellent verbal, written and computer communication skills.
Understanding of engineering principles associated with the analysis of energy-savings measures.
Knowledge of IPMVP and FEMP standards.
Valid Drivers' License issued by state of residence.

Our long-term client relationship with Jacobs has led to a need for an Electronics Component Engineer - EEE Parts for NASA xEVA Space Projects on the JSC Engineering, Technology, and Science (JETS) contract at Johnson Space Center (Houston, TX).

Kiewit Power Engineers has an immediate opening for a motivated Overhead Transmission Engineer to join our growing Power Delivery team!

Kiewit Power Delivery is a full-service engineering and construction solutions provider operating across North America.

Working hard will not only bring you satisfaction from a job well done, but it will help propel your career forward faster than you might expect.

What You Will Do This position will be filled at either the R&D Engineer 2/ R&D Engineer 3 level, depending on the skills of the selected candidate.
Additional job responsibilities (outlined below) will be assigned if the candidate is hired at the higher level.
Be part of an amazing engineering team here at the nation's Detonator Production facility that supports our Nation's nuclear deterrent.
As an Industrial Engineer you will be providing technical expertise and leadership in the design and development of process and quality improvement programs for the detonator production.

Being a hands-on Industrial Engineer with project leadership and problem-solving skills to work in our collaborative team environment, you will conduct time studies, develop, and implement work standards and participate on new product development teams.
Your work will directly provide detonation related products and services of superior quality and value to protect our nation and promote world stability.
Minimum Job Requirements: R&D Engineer 2 (99,200-$164,100)
As an R&D Engineer 2, you will be expected to have demonstrated knowledge of and experience in an engineering discipline.

With demonstrated knowledge of and experience in designing, planning, and executing problem solving and process improvement projects, you will be expected to work with members from various process teams in a collaborative manner to collect and analyze data, perform cost-benefit-risk analysis, recommend changes to processes based on the results of the analyses, define post-implementation monitoring and benefits, and help implement the changes.
You will champion change and make presentations to upper management at various points of the change study.
You will be expected to get familiar with IE models and to conduct simulations with them under the supervision of more experienced staff.
Ability to work in a team environment is a must as you will be expected to work with various process teams whose members would have varied levels of experience and expertise with the subject matter.
Prior knowledge/certification in lean manufacturing principles, statistical quality control techniques, and Six Sigma methodologies are highly desirable.

In addition to what was outlined at the lower level, at this level as an R&D Engineer 3, applies an interprets, on a broad basis, specialized, state-of-the-art engineering and scientific principles, techniques, methods, and tools to provide solutions for an extensive and diverse range of complex and/or ambiguous problems where analysis of situations or date requires in-depth evaluation of variable factors.
Leads the research, design, testing, analysis, verification, and validation of novel engineering and technology solutions in support of R&D initiatives.
Develops innovative advanced concepts, theories, methods, techniques and approaches to address specialized problems.
May contribute to the development of industry standards.
Develops new technical capabilities and creates opportunities to extend R&D engineering through the expansion of existing efforts.
Leads the development of technical products such as journal papers, reports, presentations, and concept papers.
Influences organizational, project, and program strategies and directions.
Leads technical decision-making at task level within a project.
Makes decisions and/or recommendations that influence the achievement of key programmatic objectives.
Contributes to developments in industry and develops new skills consistent with state-of-the-art.
May attain additional certifications, qualifications, and/or recognition to grow in field.

Engineering Expertise: Demonstrated knowledge and proven experience in engineering science and technology, including applying principles, techniques, procedures and equipment to the improvement and production of specialized manufacturing and manufacturing processes.
Communication Skills: Effective communication skills, both orally and in writing with diverse employees and organizations at all levels.
Having strong interpersonal skills.
Demonstrated ability to work and influence cross-functionally.

Additional Job Requirements for R&D Engineer 3: Project Management: Only for R&D Engineer 3 Position - Demonstrated experience designing, planning, and executing manufacturing and characterization projects and strong experience in solution development and implementation.
Experience leading cross-functional projects.

Process Improvement: Primarily for R&D Engineer 3 - Demonstrated ability to apply process improvement and problem-solving techniques including, but not limited to Lean and Six Sigma methodologies to address issues such as operational and quality process improvement.
Helps in developing a Lean Six Sigma organization, driven to improve performance, cost, throughput, and quality control metrics.
In addition to the requirements outlined above, qualification at the higher level requires: + Actively mentor, coach, and train junior staff.

You will be expected to provide solutions to complex IE problems involving a combination of labor, space, and technological changes under multiple constraints arising from resource availability, safety and regulatory requirements.
+ A thorough knowledge of and experience in engineering disciplines and designing, planning and executing problem solving and process improvement projects.
+ Lead teams through a problem-solving methodology (Lean Six Sigma projects and process improvement projects) using process and value stream mapping.
+ Influences organizational, project, and program strategies and directions.

Education/Experience at lower level: Position requires a Bachelor's Degree in Engineering from an ABET accredited institution and 4 years of related experience; or, an equivalent combination of education and experience directly related to the occupation.

Education/Experience at higher level: Position requires a Master's Degree in Engineering from an accredited institution and 6 years of related experience; or, an equivalent combination of education and experience directly related to the occupation.
At this level a Ph.D. may be preferred.
Desired Qualifications: + Lean, Six Sigma, and/or Lean Six Sigma certification from an accredited source.
+ Lean Six Sigma Black Belt certification from an accredited institution is highly desired.
+ Experience coaching and mentoring Green Belts, Black Belt candidates, project teams, and production personnel.
+ Demonstrated experience working in a manufacturing or production organization requiring implementation of defined manufacturing, testing, safety, and quality requirements.
+ Experience in process improvement, process engineering, or industrial engineering.
+ Expertise and experience in systems engineering, statistical process control (SPC), and lean six sigma processes.
+ Demonstrated knowledge and experience with system and subsystem qualification testing and/or analysis.
+ Experience in data mining, data manipulation, and data analysis.
+ Certification and/or experience in change management techniques.
+ Demonstrated knowledge of Conduct of Operations in a nuclear or radiological facility.
+ Existing DOE Q clearance (or similar).
Work Environment: Work Location: The work location for this position is onsite and located in Los Alamos, NM.
All work locations are at the discretion of management.

Position commitment: Regular appointment employees are required to serve a period of continuous service in their current position in order to be eligible to apply for posted jobs throughout the Laboratory.
If an employee has not served the time required, they may only apply for Laboratory jobs with the documented approval of their Division Leader.
The position commitment for this position is 1 year.
Note to Applicants: For full consideration, submit a comprehensive resume reflective of your relevant experience to the job requirements and desired skills stated above.

Where You Will Work Located in beautiful northern New Mexico, Los Alamos National Laboratory (LANL) is a multidisciplinary research institution engaged in strategic science on behalf of national security.

Our generous benefits package includes: + PPO or High Deductible medical insurance with the same large nationwide network + Dental and vision insurance + Free basic life and disability insurance + Paid childbirth and parental leave + Award-winning 401(k) (6% matching plus 3.5% annually) + Learning opportunities and tuition assistance + Flexible schedules and time off (PTO and holidays) + Onsite gyms and wellness programs + Extensive relocation packages (outside a 50 mile radius)

Please note that this requirement applies only to citizens of the United States.
Foreign nationals are subject to a similar requirement under DOE Order 142.3A.
Clearance: Q (Position will be cleared to this level).
Selected applicants will be subject to a background investigation conducted by or on behalf of the Federal Government, and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified matter.
This position requires a Q clearance.
and obtaining such clearance requires US Citizenship except in extremely rare circumstances.
Dependent upon the position, additional authorization to access classified information may be required, which may or may not be available to dual citizens.
Receipt of a Q clearance and additional access authorization ultimately is a decision of the Federal Government and not of Triad.
Eligibility requirements: To obtain a clearance, an individual must be at least 18 years of age; U.S. citizenship is required except in very limited circumstances.
See DOE Order 472.2 for additional information.
New-Employment Drug Test: The Laboratory requires successful applicants to complete a new-employment drug test and maintains a substance abuse policy that includes random drug testing.
Although New Mexico and other states have legalized the use of marijuana, use and possession of marijuana remain illegal under federal law.
A positive drug test for marijuana will result in termination of employment, even if the use was pre-offer.
Regular position: Term status Laboratory employees applying for regular-status positions are converted to regular status.
Internal Applicants: Regular appointment employees who have served the required period of continuous service in their current position are eligible to apply for posted jobs throughout the Laboratory.
If an employee has not served the required period of continuous service, they may only apply for Laboratory jobs with the documented approval of their Division Leader.
Please refer to Policy Policy P701 for applicant eligibility requirements.

Support the development of innovative technologies and manufacturing systems from the initial concept phase through the complete development process, including design engineering, validation, prototyping, testing, and evaluation of the proposed production-capable process and business case.

DISH is transforming the future of connectivity.
We're doing it by building the country's first virtualized, standalone 5G wireless network from scratch.
The foundation of a connected world, it's a network free of the limitations of the past, and flexible enough to satisfy all the social, economic and transformative needs of the changing world.
We are actively seeking an experienced and knowledgeable Principal/Senior Network Engineer to join our dynamic End-to-End Capacity Planning team.
In this role, you will play a crucial part in supporting the DISH Wireless 5G National team, acting as the subject matter expert for network capacity plans and budgets.
Your expertise will contribute to the evolution of our network, ensuring optimal performance and growth.
As a member of our team, you will collaborate closely with a talented group of engineers focused on developing annual and multi-year end-to-end network capacity plans in the 5G O-RAN network.
You will work in close partnership with various engineering, technology, and operations functions within our organization to align network planning and performance activities.
Develop annual and multi-year end-to-end network capacity plans and projections for all network platforms, including RAN, Core, IP Network, and cloud computing.
Create multi-year and annual capacity budgets for all platforms.
Maintain an end-to-end capacity modeling tool that generates detailed capacity projections for each network platform.
Collaborate with Commercial, Enterprise Sales, Marketing, and Retail Sales organizations to provide expertise on subscriber and demand forecasting.
Act as the network point of contact for operational and systems aspects related to new products or business initiatives, ensuring a clear understanding of capacity impacts.
Work closely with operations and IT teams to identify and implement the necessary systems and tools for effective network capacity management.
Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering, Electronics & Communication Engineering, or Wireless Systems Engineering.
7-9 years of hands-on experience in wireless operations and end-to-end capacity planning.
Strong knowledge of radio access technologies, wireless spectrum, and device technologies.
Solid understanding of RAN, Core, IP Network, and cloud computing concepts and implementations.
Demonstrated experience in automating planning and performance activities.
Proficiency in network modeling and network analytics.
Comprehensive understanding of the full lifecycle management of technology in wireless networks.
Familiarity with mobile network operator deployment architecture and security requirements.
Excellent written and oral communication skills, along with strong problem-solving abilities.

SAIC is seeking a GEOINT Automation Integration Engineer Principal to fill a critical position on SAIC's Prime Program, Landmark AOS located in Chantilly, VA.
LANDMARK AOS is SAIC's large Prime SETA contract, supporting the customer's Ground Enterprise Directorate (GED), responsible for the acquisition of systems over the complete program life cycle.

As the GEOINT Automation Integration Engineer Principal, you will interact daily with senior government, Program staff and external entities to ensure the proper management and execution of integration and testing activities in a persistent enterprise test environment.

Responsibilities to include + Performing segment integration activities, such as Early Integration Windows and Agile Demonstrations, in a Persistent Enterprise Test Environment in advance of Enterprise Test events + Coordinating the program office's overall test strategy and ensuring its incorporation into the enterprise test strategy + Executing acquisition functions for the test environment development teams + Improving functional test automation and continuous integration of interfacing segments + Driving consistency across interdependent programs on how they collectively approach test + Providing day-to-day collaboration with development contractors, other Government program office personnel and Government Customers on systems engineering and acquisition functions.

Qualifications Required Education and Experience: + Bachelor's degree and nine (9) years or more experience; Masters and seven (7) years or more experience (additional experience can be considered in lieu of degree).
+ Active Top Secret/SCI clearance with a CI Polygraph.
+ Knowledge of NRO GEOINT Ground Architecture.
+ Experience supporting one or more GEOINT Ground NRO programs.
+ Experience performing hands-on-keyboard testing and deriving test cases based upon system requirements, architecture, and CONOPS.
+ Previous acquisition experience.
+ Experience with development pipeline, test automation, and display tools (JIRA, Jenkins, Cucumber, Splunk, ELK, etc.).
+ Test automation and software troubleshooting experience; ability to diagnose issues with test automation or mission software based on anticipated outcomes.
+ Knowledge of the software development lifecycle (SDLC) and maturation process.
+ Ability to inspect technical designs of test automation and architecture for inadequacies and design flaws.
+ Self-starter with ability to execute job based on limited guidance/information.
+ Ability to distill complex problems into digestible structures/formats.
+ Ability to work efficiently in a dynamic environment with constantly shifting priorities and needs.
+ Strong verbal skills and ability to lead cross-organization working groups and technical meetings.

Job Overview: The Deputy Program Chief Engineer, Advanced Propulsion is a key leadership role within the Military Engines Engineering (MEE) organization at Pratt & Whitney (P&W).
The Deputy Chief Engineer (dPCE) will be instrumental in progressing high-impact technologies that will deliver game-changing and disruptive capabilities to the military warfighter.

The dPCE is responsible for providing technical, team, and programmatic leadership for a portfolio of contract programs and company-funded projects focused on advanced combustion and propulsion concepts, technologies, and systems solutions.
The dPCE will lead agile and inclusive teams of engineers across a variety of technical disciplines.

The team will be responsible for progressing challenging technology solutions through different phases of design, analysis and development including rig and systems test demonstration necessary for technical readiness and product transition.
The team extends outside the walls of P&W and requires working with weapon systems contractors, technical collaborators, and development suppliers.
These efforts are also coordinated closely with government customers through integrated teams.
Key Responsibilities: + Technical lead, focal and representative for Pratt & Whitney on high-visibility government contracts and company-funded projects.
+ Agile team leadership across different technical disciplines, Raytheon Technologies (RTX) business units, engineering collaborators and suppliers.
+ Programmatic leadership, including project, risk and earned value management.
+ Technical coordination and regular engagement with government customers.
Basic Qualifications: + Bachelor's degree in Engineering and 12+ years of relevant experience, or + Advanced Engineering degree and 10+ years of relevant experience.
+ U.S. citizenship due to government contracts.
+ Must have an active secret security clearance.
+ Project and risk management experience.
+ Onsite, work location is East Hartford, Connecticut.
Preferred Qualifications: + Strong verbal and written communication skills.
+ Demonstrated team and technical leadership.

+ Demonstrated record, applied experience and subject matter expertise in advanced combustion, propulsion systems, technologies, and air vehicle integration specific to rotating detonation engines (RDE), pulse detonation engines (PDE) and/or other forms of high-speed propulsion.
+ Proficiency in agile frameworks and principles for project and team management.
+ Experience and understanding of digital systems engineering.

Information Technology is responsible for the effective development, delivery and operation of computing and information services.
Anticipates, plans and delivers IT solutions and strategy which enable business value.

What Software Asset Management contributes to Cardinal Health: The Software Asset Management team's primary responsibility is to drive SAP software license compliance policies, conduct proactive internal compliance audits, manage Cardinal Health's software license lifecycle (purchasing, (re)deploying, harvesting), and provide savings opportunities through software harvesting and license optimization processes.
Ability to navigate a highly matrixed organization effectively and foster the use of analytics for data-driven insights.
Proven ability to quickly build relationships and earn the trust of sponsors and key stakeholders.
Proactively collaborate with SAP product teams to understand license needs, develop forecast, and identify and address compliance issues.
Educate EIT solution and product owners on proper asset management compliance practices and enforce roles/responsibilities.
Manage Cardinal Health's SAP software license lifecycle (purchase, deploy, harvest).
Designs, analyzes, and provides operational metrics to highlight opportunities to increase efficiency, optimize cost and reduce risk.
Partners with external suppliers, business clients and internal IT solution owners.
Specialize in SAP asset management best practices, and acts as SAP license administer.
Drive software harvesting and optimization.
Partner with EIT product teams to identify non-usage of software installations within the infrastructure and perform software removals as needed.

Design, analyze, and provide operational metrics to highlight opportunities to increase software license cost efficiencies, optimize software license savings, and reduce software license compliance risks.
Harvest SAP software and complete product bundling to remediate compliance gaps.
Facilitate internal and external audits.
Implement process to initiate, maintain and decommission SAP software licensing.
Manage ServiceNow queue for SAP license requests and issues.
Import software license purchases and assigns licenses to SAP in ServiceNow.
Purchase necessary software using BuyNow.
Identify and submit SCCM software package requests for new software titles/versions.
Administer vendor license keys and subscription web portals.
Manages ITAM's shared email mailbox.
Manages ITAM's digital software media library.
Work closely with R&M to ensure maintenance contracts are renewed accurately and timely.
Bachelor's in related field, or equivalent work experience preferred.
5+ years' experience in SAP asset management preferred.
ServiceNow (reports, asset module) preferred.
Proficient in Excel (formulas, pivot tables, etc.) preferred.
Ability to analyze raw data in order to make conclusions and reveal trends and metrics preferred.
Excellent oral and written communications preferred.
Experience working with contracts as it relates to terms and conditions preferred.
Maintains and governs all the activities within our SAP license agreements.
Maintains SAP license inventory properly by measuring license utilization.
Assist with any SAP licenses purchases, terminations and/or exchanges.
Assist business with any SAP license estimation costs.
Lead SAP license Audit activities.
Assist in negotiation of SAP discounts and other EULA term components.
Applies comprehensive knowledge and a thorough understanding of concepts, principles, and technical capabilities to perform varied tasks and projects.
May contribute to the development of policies and procedures.
Works on complex projects of large scope.
Develops technical solutions to a wide range of difficult problems.
Solutions are innovative and consistent with organization objectives.
Completes work independently receives general guidance on new projects.
Work reviewed for purpose of meeting objectives.

Design Verification Engineer Santa Clara Valley (Cupertino),California,United States

Hardware + Deep knowledge of SystemVerilog and UVM + Deep knowledge in developing scalable and portable test-benches + Proven experience with verification methodologies and tools such as simulators, waveform viewers
Build and run automation, coverage collection, gate level simulations
Some UVM knowledge, C/C++ level knowledge
Deep experience with serial protocols such as PCIe or USB, parallel protocol such as DDR
Basic knowledge of formal verification methodology
Some experience with power-aware (UPF) or similar verification methodology
Knowledge of one of the scripting languages such as Python, Perl, TCL
In this role, you will be responsible for ensuring bug-free first silicon for part of the SoC / IP and are encouraged to develop detailed test and coverage plans based on the micro-architecture
You are responsible for developing verification methodology suitable for the IP, ensuring a scalable and portable environment.
You will get to develop verification environment, including all the respective components such as stimulus, checkers, assertions, trackers, coverage.

Furthermore, you will learn to develop verification plans for all features under your care, execute verification plans, including design bring-up, DV environment bring-up, regression enabling all features under your care, and debug of the test failures.
You will also learn to develop block, IP and SoC level test-benches track and report DV progress using a variety of metrics, including bugs and coverage.
Prefers Bachelor of Science degree with meaningful experience or internships

Program Chief Engineer - Commercial LEO Programs (Onsite)
Location: Houston, TX OR Windsor Locks, CT
Collins Aerospace Systems is one of the world's largest suppliers of technologically advanced aerospace and defense products.
Space, Sensing, Controls is a business unit within Collins and our products reside in deep space, low earth orbit, undersea and on the ground.
We are also a major supplier to international space programs.
The Space, Sensing, Controls business has contributed to significant advances in ground, air, space and imaging technology for over 85 years.

Within Space, Sensing & Control we design and manufacture Environmental Control and Life Support Systems on the International Space Station, including the space suit, undersea in submarines and multiple programs supporting the NASA's Artemis Program, which will establish a sustainable presence on the Moon to prepare for missions to Mars.
Collins is seeking a Program Chief Engineer for its Commercial Low Earth Orbit Destinations Programs (CLD).
The CLD Chief Engineer will be the focal point for the development and deployment of the next generation of Collins products for Space Travel and Tourism serving the Commercial Space Markets.

The Chief Engineer takes direction from the LEO Value Steam Chief Engineer, and provides oversight and direction to commercial space programs and directs cross functional Integrated Product Teams (IPTs) tasked to design, develop, procure, assemble, and test LEO-CLD Hardware within the approved budget and schedule.
The Chief Engineer plays a critical role in being the technical focal to the customer and driving project execution while meeting both internal and external customer expectations.
Key to the role is a regular review cadence of Team progress, actions, risks, budgets, schedules, and issues.

The successful candidate will be able to recognize when the Team needs assistance and invoke timely escalation of problems for assistance and solicit subject matter experts to rapidly resolve problems as they arise.
The candidate will drive the execution of all engineering responsibilities on the program while meeting both internal and external customer expectations.
Direct communication with the program will be required - including daily tag-ups, weekly meetings, and quarterly meetings.
Primary Responsibilities:
+ As the Chief Engineer, you will be accountable for the cost, schedule, and technical performance of the programs assigned to you.
+ Acts as primary technical interface to program management and the customer
+ Provides technical direction to overall assigned LEO programs
+ Continually matures Development Plan throughout life cycle
+ Plans engineering resources in support of scope, schedule, and budget
+ Plans Design Reviews in alignment with approved project plans and risk mitigation burn-down
+ Drives the technical plan to meet baseline cost and schedule targets
+ Analyze, identify, and address execution problems, recommend and implement resolutions to ensure the successful completion of project(s)
+ Support root cause investigations and corrective actions for field and production issues
+ Develop bids based on proposal requests
+ Participate in continuous improvement efforts
+ Identifies and Defines Technical Risk & Opportunity
+ Compiles, presents, and communicates overall engineering program metrics
+ Meets the design to cost (DTC) goals
+ Executes assigned design and development scope, including requirements, design, implementation, verification, and validation
Basic Qualifications:

+ Bachelor's degree (typically in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM)) and a minimum of 10 years of prior relevant experience unless prohibited by local laws/regulations OR Advanced Degree in a related field and minimum 7 years experience OR In absence of a degree, 14 years of relevant experience is required
+ Must be a U.S. Citizen
Preferred Qualifications:
+ BA/BS in Mechanical, Electrical or Chemical Engineering degree w/10 + years of experience
+ MA/MS in Mechanical, Electrical Engineering or Chemical Engineer or MBA degree w/ 7 + years of experience /qualifications
+ Prior experience in related Engineering discipline(s).
+ Experience with electromechanical hardware
+ Experience in design and qualification of Environmental Life Support Systems (ECLSS) and Active Thermal Control Systems (ATCS) is a plus
+ Exceptional organizational, analytical, written and verbal communication skills
+ Ability to multi-task and prioritize both daily issues and strategize longer term projects
+ Superior interpersonal and influencing skills, including coaching and mentoring of other engineering staff
+ Strong computer skills, MS Office, PLM Windchill, SAP
+ Natural presence/comfortable presenting to internal and external customers
+ Ability to bring team members together and work problems to resolution

The Drive System Analysis Engineer at Bell Helicopter is responsible for analysis activities related to preparation and release of engineering data for complex mechanical components including gears, bearings, shafts, housings and other supporting components as well as subsystem integration.
Furthermore, the Drive System Analysis Engineer supports the manufacturing, assembly and validation of these mechanical components.
Finally, the Drive System Analysis Engineer ensures compliance with all best practices, customer and industry specifications in support of air vehicle performance and safety requirements.
This position is located at Bell Helicopter's Ft. Worth, TX headquarters facility.
Create detail, assembly and installation drive system design definition utilizing FEM software and other various analytical tools.
Support manufacturing and testing of drive system components and sub-systems interpreting technical data and assisting in product improvements.
Improve detail, assembly and installation drive system design definition utilizing FEM software and other various analytical tools.
Participate in a cross functional team environment completing a variety of objectives depending on the program lifecycle assigned.
Advance the state-of-the-art drive system through creative thought, personal and team research, technical compliance and strong analysis skills.
Bachelor's Degree in Mechanical or Aerospace Engineering is required.
Other equivalent engineering disciplines will be considered with sufficient mechanical component experience.
Master's Degree in the Engineering as described above is preferred.

Multiple levels will be considered for this position with a minimum of 5 years of mechanical engineering analysis experience in the following areas: Aerospace or Automotive environment, focused on mechanical components such as gears, bearings, shafting, etc.
Precision manufacturing focused on mechanical component manufacturing processes such as metal machining, heat treatments, and other specialized processes.
Proficiency with engineering design definition including 2D/3D modeling, requirement capture and specification development.
Utilization of ANSYS, Mathcad, Matlab, alternate FEM software (Abaqus, Patran/Nastran, etc.), AB Jones, KIMOS, AGMA related analysis tools, etc.
Experience working with PLM software such as ENOVIA to drive product lifecycle.
Must have working knowledge of GD&T requirements.
Proficiency with basic office computer software, specifically the Microsoft office suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, etc.).
Must have demonstrated ability to work in a team environment and ability to articulate technical data and concepts to a wide audience of individuals of different technical backgrounds.
Must have demonstrated ability to organize and prioritize a variety of activities and tasks while dealing with change.
Must have a strong analytical ability.
Previous experience working on cross functional engineering programs is preferred.

At ExxonMobil, our vision is to lead in energy innovations that advance modern living and a net-zero future.
As one of the world's largest publicly traded energy and chemical companies, we are powered by a unique and diverse workforce fueled by the pride in what we do and what we stand for.
The success of our Upstream, Product Solutions and Low Carbon Solutions businesses is the result of the talent, curiosity and drive of our people.
They bring solutions every day to optimize our strategy in energy, chemicals, lubricants and lower-emissions technologies.
We invite you to bring your ideas to ExxonMobil to help create sustainable solutions that improve quality of life and meet society's evolving needs.
ExxonMobil's state-of-the-art campus north of Houston serves as home to its Upstream, Product Solutions and Low Carbon Solutions businesses and their associated service groups.
The facility opened in 2014 and accommodates more than 10,000 employees and visitors.

By bringing many global functional groups together, the campus provides employees with the tools and capabilities needed today, and in the future, to achieve business objectives and accelerate the discovery of new resources, technologies and products.
It was designed to foster improved collaboration, creativity and innovation and enhance the company's ability to attract, develop and retain the top talent in the industry.

The campus is located in Spring, Texas, on 385 wooded acres immediately to the west of Interstate Highway 45 (I-45), at the intersection of I-45 and the Hardy Toll Road, approximately 25 miles from the cultural vibrancy of downtown Houston.
The campus was constructed to the highest standards of energy efficiency and environmental stewardship.
Its design incorporates extensive research into best practices in building and workplace design through extensive benchmarking of the world's top academic, research, and corporate facilities.

Unconventional reservoir engineers are exposed to many facets of our unconventional oil resource, starting with acreage acquisition, through to planning for and executing development, development optimization, and production surveillance.
Provide reservoir engineering technical support and expertise to its Conventional Oil & Gas development projects and production operations.
Work with multi-discipline teams to support optimal asset development and operation.
Leverage fundamental reservoir engineering skills in reservoir description, surveillance, performance prediction, economics, development planning, opportunity generation and production optimization.
Typically engineers are responsible for all operated / non-operated / industry work within an assigned work area.
The position is located at ExxonMobil campus in Spring, Texas.

Collaborate with integrated development team to optimize the plan for development which includes the generation of full life cycle volumes forecasts, securing funding for individual wells, forming appraisal schedules and optimizing development for midstream facility capacity.
Review all new / existing well results and craft experimentation to illuminate opportunities to further drive economic improvements in wells / development plan.
Optimize drillwell execution plans (flowback, choke ramp schedule, data collection, etc.).
Document development plan, on a by well basis, as part of the annual reserves and resource assessment; communicate changes in expectations / data needs to broader development team.
Work closely with mergers, acquisitions & divestments financial modelers to establish transactional values, and facilitate the purchase and trading of acreage.
Bachelor's degree in Engineering required - preferably Petroleum, Chemical, or Mechanical.
A minimum of 5 years of experience in Reservoir Engineering.
Demonstrated work experience in unconventional developments.
Ability to complete decline curve analysis, develop drillwell locations, perform economic evaluations, and prepare area for reserve report review.
Proficiency in Aries, Excel, Word, RTA analysis, Spotfire and other industry software.
Candidates should be self-motivated and focused on achieving business results while working in a multi-disciplinary team.
Demonstrated teamwork, communication and leadership skills are essential.
Demonstrated work experience with performing acquisition evaluations.
Data analytics.
Foundational reservoir engineering skills, such as competency in rock and fluid properties.
Experience integrating advanced diagnostic and/or reservoir simulation work products into reservoir engineering analysis.
General industry knowledge.

We are looking for a candidate to join a growing Optical and Mechanical Systems Team as an Optical Engineer to help unlock future AR/VR display technologies.

As part of the Hardware Research organization at Reality Labs, you will be responsible for leading the generation of new optical system concepts, designing prototypes, and characterization of optical performance for research projects.
You will have the opportunity to be part of a team composed of some of the best engineers, scientists and leaders defining the field of AR/VR.

Conceptualize and lead the design of new prototype optical systems and components such as: projectors, illumination sources, imaging systems, interferometry systems, laser systems, and physical optics.
Design custom lenses and optical subsystems with ray tracing software, including lens elements, multi-lens systems, and other optical components.
Establish optical engineering specifications, including key performance metrics, optical manufacturing tolerances, and test requirements for optical subsystems and components.
Lead development of custom metrology and measurement systems.
Drive collaboration and resources with internal cross functional teams and external industry partners.
5+ years of experience in designing optical systems and components.
BS in Engineering, Physics, Optics or equivalent work experience.
Experience using optical design software such as Zemax or Code V.
Experience working in a lab environment with optical systems and lasers.
Experience with hands-on assembly, alignment, integration, and testing of optical components and optical systems.
Experience in optical tolerance analysis, including mechanical positional tolerances and defining lens manufacturing tolerances.
Advanced degree (MS or PhD) in the field of Optical Engineering, Physics, or related field.
Experience designing lenses for diamond turning and molding.
Experience designing freeform optical surfaces.
Experience with polarization optics, films and coatings.
Experience collaborating with internal and external vendors for optic fabrication including knowledge of ISO 10110 standard.
7+ years of experience leading advanced optics development.
Proficiency with ZEMAX, CODE V, FRED etc.
Experience with design/assembly of small form-factor imaging systems.
Experience using scripting languages and data analysis tools such MATLAB, and Python.
Experience designing optical systems incorporating diffractive optical elements and building measurement systems to characterize diffractive optical elements.
$167,000/year to $230,000/year + bonus + equity + benefits

The Tool Quality Engineer is responsible to focus on developing, establishing and maintaining Mission Assurance policies and procedures, processes and controls thereby ensuring both performance and quality of manufactured products conform to established company, international (AS9100), and governmental requirements, as well as lasting customer satisfaction.
+ Understand the tool design intent, failure modes, requirements and specifications of the product as well as the manufacturing processes, process controls, statistics, SPC, and quality inspections.

+ Prior quality or process engineering experience.
+ The ability to obtain an active DoD Secret or Top Secret clearance.

+ With minimal supervision, assist with collecting, compiling, and analyzing data from the physical work site, surveys, blueprints, GIS data, maps, technical data, and other matrices for project development, design, and construction.

At Polaris Inc., we have fun doing what we love by driving change and innovation.
We empower employees to take on challenging assignments and roles with an elevated level of responsibility in our agile working environment.
Our people make us who we are, and we create incredible products and experiences that empower us to THINK OUTSIDE.
Our team develops and delivers best in class off-road vehicle dynamics performance to our customers through innovative chassis controls features and electromechanical systems.

Active chassis calibration and controls engineers are responsible for providing input to hardware development as well as developing actively controlled chassis technologies and control systems to deliver confident and exciting vehicle dynamics and chassis controls performance to our customers.
This position will have a specific focus on our chassis comfort systems such as electronic power steering, semi-active suspension, and electronic brake controls.

As a Sr. Staff Engineering position, there is an expectation of leadership to the other engineers in the group and across the organization along with general architecture decisions of how all the individual chassis comfort systems come together.

The engineer will be expected to collaborate with product groups and broader engineering teams for successful integration of actively controlled chassis technologies and control systems into the various vehicle platforms.

Uses engineering judgement, simulation, and test data to develop and specify software requirements, hardware requirements, calibration activities, and validation testing required for successful implementation of electromechanical hardware and control system technologies.
Performance testing and data collection is required to ensure that the systems meets the performance targets for the vehicle.
Responsible for translating vehicle-level requirements to system level specifications that accurately reflect the business needs.
Capable of architecting, calibrating, and generating requirements for complex chassis control systems.
Expected to lead the development of future looking advancements in the system architecture and development in the chassis controls space.
Identify and lead pre-development activities including concept development and rapid controls prototyping of new technologies and features.
Develop and specify system level fault reactions and control system diagnostics.
Oversees end-to-end calibration and development activities to ensure robust system design.
Interacts with and influences multiple engineering teams and disciplines in hardware design, electrical systems, interfacing controllers, manufacturing, service, and external suppliers.
Defines system level service and production line procedures required for new product introduction.
Expected to provide feedback and identify issues with software and algorithm design.
Root-cause analysis and troubleshooting of controls and hardware systems.

Lead and enforce development process for functional safety using risk assessment tools, including hazard analysis and risk assessment (HARA), failure modes and effects analysis (FMEA) and track resultant tests and validation activities for related technologies.
BS Engineering Degree in related field (mechanical, electrical, etc.) with 6+ years of vehicle testing and controls development related experience.
Experience with testing, calibration of electromechanical systems, or data collection is required (power steering, engine controlled, brake systems, semi-active damping).
Automotive chassis calibration and development experience of power steering or other systems.
Knowledge and experience with data analytics using Matlab, Python, or other tools required.
Experience with calibration and development tools including Vector, ETAS/Inca, AVL Creta.
Read and understand software diagrams (Matlab/Simulink or other).
Solid understanding of how a control system and hardware are developed together to be functional.
Experience working with complex vehicle systems with multiple integrated controllers.
In depth knowledge and experience with controller area networks (CAN) and calibration communication protocols and tools.
Demonstrated technical leadership and communication with cross-functional teams and multiple engineering disciplines.
Experience with data acquisition systems, electronics, harness fabrication, as well as various sensors needed to make engineering decisions or develop vehicle system models.
Fundamental knowledge and experience in vehicle dynamics required.
Knowledge of embedded control system development required.
Hands-on experience with vehicle repair and maintenance is a plus.
Some travel is required for vehicle development (~4 weeks annually depending on projects and timing).
Ability to drive off-road vehicles is required, extensive experience driving off-road vehicles, ATV's, snowmobiles, or motorcycles is a plus.
Fast paced office environment.
Wyoming, MN is the preferred working location, remote or other Polaris locations will be evaluated as required.

The Residential Operations GAF Continuous Improvement Engineer is responsible for supporting the integration of continuous improvement in the plant operations at a large-scale Residential manufacturing facility.
Responsible and accountable for continuous improvement and efficiencies across the plant's products, systems, operations and processes.
This position reports directly to the Plant Manager.
The ideal candidate will have a solid lean and/or six sigma background with the ability to coach, train and drive these projects within the plant.

Specific responsibilities include, but are not limited to: Lead the implementation of lean principles to drive results (Safety, Quality, Customer Delivery, Cost Management) in a fast-paced manufacturing environment.

This is a change agent role meaning it is accountable for achieving results by implementing lean manufacturing methods through influence, facilitation, coaching, and mentoring the production and support teams (without any direct authority).
Create a culture of continuous improvement by engaging people in improving the business.
Developing the site team through hands-on improvement projects combined with relevant training in all manufacturing, support, and administrative functions.
Measure and report progress to the site team and Plant Manager.
Ensuring that improvement projects and training are consistent with GAF Business Systems standards and sustained over time.
Advertising the plant team's successes to upper management and ensuring credit is given at the lowest level possible in the organization.
Conduct gap assessments and ensure conformance to requirements of GAF Business Systems standards.
Develop programs for quality improvements and actively promotes Continuous Improvement.
Present, facilitates and leads assigned process improvement events (Kaizen).
Train and develop staff competencies in basic and advanced problem solving methodologies.
Collaborate with cross-organizational manufacturing management teams to ensure appropriate participation and support.
A Bachelor's Degree, preferably in Engineering, or the equivalent of 5+ years in a leadership role in manufacturing.
Experience in implementing continuous improvements and improvement systems is a plus.
Experience in supporting logistics, supply chain and 3rd party outsourcing and application of industrial systems management (IE methods) are a plus.
Excellent leadership, organizational and follow-up skills.
Strong problem solving, team building, planning and decision making skills.
Driven and able to influence others through leadership, teaching, and hands-on demonstrations of Lean principles and practices.
Able to communicate effectively through all facets of the organization.
Positive influencing, encouraging, and motivating others to get results.
Effective presentation and group facilitation skills are required.
Proficient in developing Google Sheets, Slides, etc.
Knowledgeable of bills of material, inventory methods, and purchasing strategies.
Solid understanding of quality systems (data management, lab/test equipment calibration management, sampling and test plans, nonconformance/disposition, supplier management, CAPA, auditing).
Ability to work independently, manage through others and maintain schedules and deadlines.
